commit_message:
Remove log translations

Log messages are no longer being translated. This removes all use of
the _LE, _LI, and _LW translation markers to simplify logging and to
avoid confusion with new contributions.

See:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2016-November/002574.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html

Change-Id: I2b70b72ac633c559e7ad366d6a1c1763aebf562a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-muranoclient refs/changes/59/447859/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # Translators for log levels. # # The abbreviated names are meant to reflect the usual use of a short # name like '_'. The "L" is for "log" and the other letter comes from # the level. _LI = _translators.log_info _LW = _translators.log_warning _LE = _translators.log_error _LC = _translators.log_critical

commit_message:
Move revoke events to DocumentedRuleDefault

The overall goal is to define a richer policy for deployers
and operators[0]. To achieve that goal a new policy
class was introduce that requires additional parameters
when defining policy objects.

This patch switches our revoke events policy object to
the policy.DocumentedRuleDefault and fills the
required policy parameters as needed.

[0] I2b59f92545c5ead2a883d358f72f3ad3b3dfe1a6

Change-Id: Idfa3e5cd373c560035d03dfdef4ea303e28a92fc
Partially-Implements: bp policy-docs

commit_message:
Adds role inference tests to v3 test_roles_rbac.

Currently, test_roles_rbac does not have a test for
all v3 role endpoints. Among them are the inference
role endpoints.

This patch adds a test for each of the endpoints
introduced here [0].

However, note that it appears that 1 endpoint is
missing from [0], and once added to Tempest, a
corresponding test will be added in a future patch.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/425702/7/tempest/lib/services/identity/v3/roles_client.py

Change-Id: I3e2f4220f68f95fce7e9d31127586fa004c3ac5d

commit_message:
Delete import_exceptions from tox.ini

Current hacking check actually does not check attribute-level
imports. We can safely drop import_exceptions from tox.ini.

Change-Id: I4698f417369b7a7767ff4c27b4dc96c1ec14b8d2

commit_message:
Stop using config option sqlite_db

Config option sqlite_db is deprecated
in 0a1bae9859079fb21a03716be947c5f1da6db0a2, and now we use database
with sqlite in memory mode[1] like this: CONF.set_default('connection',
"sqlite://", group='database')so don't need use config option sqlite_db
any more and override its default value.

[1]http://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/rel_1_0/core/engines.html#sqlite

back-port: fixes critical failure in config generation.

Change-Id: Ic7ef914757b0613ea7209a893fad126b5a6c00a1
(cherry picked from commit b96e50e762bfafdd54ec692fc8974fef72d6f758)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/congress refs/changes/52/452352/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: max_pool_size=10, max_overflow=20, pool_timeout=10)

commit_message:
tests: fix etcd and consul test run

There was a typo in pifpaf call where the prefix for the variable name should
be prefixed by using the -e option and not -g.

Change-Id: I5a97e0a0ffc5ba675914bb0881520ddc9693fa1b

commit_message:
Add test case for volume unmanage and manage

Lots of Cinder backend drivers have support unmanage and manage
features. It's necessary to add test case for these feature apis.

Including:

[1] Add volume manage client as library
[2] Add unmanage volume api to v2 volumes client
[3] Add release note
[4] Add test case: test_volume_unmanage_manage

Depends-On: I055aa66738deb5ae2fb925429cec565e3901340c
Change-Id: I4294de92a801db2697ba870ff1b5fdbe4b2f5a4b

added_lines: # Copyright 2017 FiberHome Telecommunication Technologies CO.,LTD # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from tempest.api.volume import base from tempest.common import waiters from tempest.common.utils import data_utils from tempest import config from tempest.lib import decorators CONF = config.CONF class VolumeManageAdminV2Test(base.BaseVolumeAdminTest): @decorators.idempotent_id('70076c71-0ce1-4208-a8ff-36a66e65cc1e') def test_unmanage_manage_volume(self): # create volume volume = self.create_volume() volume_id = volume['id'] volume = self.admin_volume_client.show_volume(volume_id)['volume'] # unmanage volume host = volume['os-vol-host-attr:host'] volume_type = volume['volume_type'] source_volume_name = "volume-%s" % volume_id availability_zone = volume['availability_zone'] self.admin_volume_client.unmanage_volume(volume_id) self.admin_volume_client.wait_for_resource_deletion(volume_id) # manage volume new_vol_name = data_utils.rand_name( self.__class__.__name__ + '-volume') new_vol_info = {'host': host, 'ref': {'source-name': source_volume_name}, 'name': new_vol_name, 'volume_type': volume_type, 'availability_zone': availability_zone} volume = self.admin_volume_client.manage_volume( **new_vol_info)['volume'] new_vol_id = volume['id'] self.addCleanup(self.delete_volume, self.admin_volume_client, new_vol_id) waiters.wait_for_volume_status(self.admin_volume_client, new_vol_id, 'available') volume = self.admin_volume_client.show_volume(new_vol_id)['volume'] self.assertEqual(volume['os-vol-host-attr:host'], host) self.assertEqual(volume['name'], new_vol_name) self.assertEqual(volume['volume_type'], volume_type) self.assertEqual(volume['availability_zone'], availability_zone)

commit_message:
Rewrite of Admin Guide Live Migration Usage

The Live Migration Usage page was outdated and lacked
information.

Change-Id: I85ba063e0de6cbe0f06966d9e2067825d591d093
Closes-Bug: #1665860
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/48/441748/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ====================== Live-migrate instances ====================== Live-Migrating an instance means moving its virtual machine to a different OpenStack Compute server while the instance continues running. Before starting a live-migration, review the chapter :ref:`section_configuring-compute-migrations`. It covers the configuration settings required to enable live-migration, but also reasons for migrations and non-live-migration options. The instructions below cover shared-storage and volume-backed migration. To block-migrate instances, add the command-line option ``--block-migrate`` to the ``nova live-migration`` command, and ``--block-migration`` to the ``openstack server migrate`` command. .. _manual_selection_of_dest: Manual selection of the destination host ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ #. Obtain the ID of the instance you want to migrate:#. Determine on which host the instance is currently running. In this example, $ openstack compute service list +----+------------------+-------+----------+---------+-------+----------------------------+ | ID | Binary | Host | Zone | Status | State | Updated At | +----+------------------+-------+----------+---------+-------+----------------------------+ | 3 | nova-conductor | HostA | internal | enabled | up | 2017-02-18T09:42:29.000000 | | 4 | nova-scheduler | HostA | internal | enabled | up | 2017-02-18T09:42:26.000000 | | 5 | nova-consoleauth | HostA | internal | enabled | up | 2017-02-18T09:42:29.000000 | | 6 | nova-compute | HostB | nova | enabled | up | 2017-02-18T09:42:29.000000 | | 7 | nova-compute | HostC | nova | enabled | up | 2017-02-18T09:42:29.000000 | +----+------------------+-------+----------+---------+-------+----------------------------+#. Migrate the instance: #. Confirm that the instance has been migrated successfully: .. code-block:: console $ openstack server show d1df1b5a-70c4-4fed-98b7-423362f2c47c +----------------------+--------------------------------------+ | Field | Value | +----------------------+--------------------------------------+ | ... | ... | | OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:host | HostC | | ... | ... | +----------------------+--------------------------------------+ If the instance is still running on ``HostB``, migration failed. The ``nova-scheduler`` and ``nova-conductor`` log files on the controller and the ``nova-compute`` log file on the source compute host can help pin-point the problem. .. _auto_selection_of_dest: Automatic selection of the destination host ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ To leave the selection of the destination host to Nova, you have to use the nova command-line client. #. Obtain the instance ID as shown in step 1 of the Manual Selection section above. #. Leave out the host selection steps 2, 3 and 4. #. Migrate the instance: .. code-block:: console $ nova live-migration d1df1b5a-70c4-4fed-98b7-423362f2c47c Monitoring the migration ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ #. A simple check While the migration is progressing, the instance state is MIGRATING. To confirm this: .. code-block:: console $ openstack server show d1df1b5a-70c4-4fed-98b7-423362f2c47c +----------------------+--------------------------------------+ | Field | Value | +----------------------+--------------------------------------+ | ... | ... | | status | MIGRATING | | ... | ... | +----------------------+--------------------------------------+ #. Check migration progress Use the nova command-line client for Nova's migration monitoring feature. First, obtain the migration ID. .. code-block:: console $ nova server-migration-list d1df1b5a-70c4-4fed-98b7-423362f2c47c .... *output to be done* .... In this example, the migration ID is 77. Use it to get the migration status. .. code-block:: console $ nova server-migration-show d1df1b5a-70c4-4fed-98b7-423362f2c47c 77 .... *output to be done* .... What to do when the migration times out ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ During the migration process, the instance may write to a memory page after that page has been copied to the destination. When that happens, the same page has to be copied again. The instance may write to memory pages faster than they can be copied, so that the migration can't complete. Nova will eventually cancel it when the ``live_migration_completion_timeout``, a configuration parameter, is reached. The following remarks assume the KVM/Libvirt hypervisor. How to know that the migration timed out ---------------------------------------- To determine that the migration timed out, inspect the ``nova-compute`` log file on the source host. The following log entry shows that the migration timed out: .. code-block:: console # grep WARNING.*d1df1b5a-70c4-4fed-98b7-423362f2c47c /var/log/nova/nova-compute.log ... WARNING nova.virt.libvirt.migration [req-...] [instance: ...] live migration not completed after 1800 sec Nova also cancels migrations when the memory copy doesn't seem to make progress. Ocata disables this feature by default, but it can be enabled using the configuration parameter ``live_migration_progress_timeout``. Should this be the case, you may find the following message in the log: .. code-block:: console WARNING nova.virt.libvirt.migration [req-...] [instance: ...] live migration stuck for 150 sec Addressing migration timeouts ----------------------------- To stop the migration from putting load on infrastructure resources like network and disks, you may opt to cancel it manually. .. code-block:: console $ nova live-migration-abort INSTANCE_ID MIGRATION_ID To make live-migration succeed, you have several options. - **Manually force-complete the migration** .. code-block:: console $ nova live-migration-force-complete INSTANCE_ID MIGRATION_ID The instance is paused until memory copy completes. Since the pause impacts time keeping on the instance, and not all applications tolerate wrong time settings, use this approach with caution. - **Enable auto-convergence** Auto-convergence is a Libvirt feature. Libvirt detects that the migration is unlikely to complete and slows down its CPU until the memory copy process is faster than the instance's memory writes. To enable auto-convergence, set ``live_migration_permit_auto_convergence=true`` in ``nova.conf`` and restart nova-compute. Do this on all compute hosts. One possible downside of auto-convergence is the slowing down of the instance. - **Enable post-copy** This is another Libvirt feature. Again, Libvirt detects that the migration doesn't progress, but responds by activating the virtual machine on the destination host before all its memory has been copied. Accesses to missing memory pages result in page faults that are satisfied from the source host. To enable post-copy, set ``live_migration_permit_post_copy=true`` in ``nova.conf`` and restart nova-compute. Do this on all compute hosts. When post-copy is enabled, manual force-completion doesn't pause the instance but switches to the post-copy process. Possible downsides: When the network connection between source and destination is interrupted, page-faults can't be resolved anymore, and the virtual machine is rebooted. Furthermore, post-copy may lead to an increased page-fault rate during migration, which slows the instance down.
deleted_lines: ================= Migrate instances ================= This section discusses how to migrate running instances from one OpenStack Compute server to another OpenStack Compute server. Before starting a migration, review the Configure migrations section. :ref:`section_configuring-compute-migrations`. .. note:: Although the :command:`nova` command is called :command:`live-migration`, under the default Compute configuration options, the instances are suspended before migration. For more information, see `Configure migrations <https://docs.openstack.org/ocata/config-reference/compute/config-options.html>`_. in the OpenStack Configuration Reference. **Migrating instances** #. Check the ID of the instance to be migrated: +--------------------------------------+------+--------+-----------------+------------+#. Check the information associated with the instance. In this example, $ openstack compute service list +----+------------------+-------+----------+---------+-------+----------------------------+ | ID | Binary | Host | Zone | Status | State | Updated At | +----+------------------+-------+----------+---------+-------+----------------------------+ | 3 | nova-conductor | HostA | internal | enabled | up | 2017-02-18T09:42:29.000000 | | 4 | nova-scheduler | HostA | internal | enabled | up | 2017-02-18T09:42:26.000000 | | 5 | nova-consoleauth | HostA | internal | enabled | up | 2017-02-18T09:42:29.000000 | | 6 | nova-compute | HostB | nova | enabled | up | 2017-02-18T09:42:29.000000 | | 7 | nova-compute | HostC | nova | enabled | up | 2017-02-18T09:42:29.000000 | +----+------------------+-------+----------+---------+-------+----------------------------+#. Migrate the instance using the :command:`openstack server migrate` command: .. code-block:: console $ openstack server migrate SERVER --live HOST_NAME In this example, SERVER can be the ID or name of the instance. Another example: Migration of d1df1b5a-70c4-4fed-98b7-423362f2c47c initiated. .. warning:: When using live migration to move workloads between Icehouse and Juno compute nodes, it may cause data loss because libvirt live migration with shared block storage was buggy (potential loss of data) before version 3.32. This issue can be solved when we upgrade to RPC API version 4.0. #. Check that the instance has been migrated successfully, using :command:`openstack server list`. If the instance is still running on ``HostB``, check the log files at ``src/dest`` for ``nova-compute`` and ``nova-scheduler`` to determine why.

commit_message:
Remove deprecated compute config options for validation-2

Below compute config options for validation server had been
deprecated with corresponding options in validation group almost
year back.
- 1908e37d2551760831e338788511db93d5129e16

    - ``compute.image_ssh_user`` (available as ``validation.image_ssh_user``)
    - ``compute.ssh_user`` (available as ``validation.image_ssh_user``)
    - ``scenario.ssh_user`` (available as ``validation.image_ssh_user``)
    - ``compute.network_for_ssh`` (available as ``validation.network_for_ssh``)
    - ``compute.ping_timeout `` (available as ``validation.ping_timeout``)

This patch removes them from tempest conf.

Few plugins still using the old configs and this depends on their fix.

Change-Id: I2221b2d50fee97a464c7d5f0b3c2e13142cb394f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/97/434097/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Rework golang-dsvm job

* Check for existence of files before creating the hooks
  (Improvement suggested by sdague in previous review)
* Run a minimum of services to reduce time of job to
  start
* Skip tempest and exercises to reduce time

Change-Id: I096a93bf4dfe7df550af780e7828dbac127a783a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/23/452323/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Disable tempest and exercises export DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST=0 export DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_NOTESTS=1 export DEVSTACK_GATE_EXERCISES=0 export PROJECTS="openstack/{name} $PROJECTS" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'\n'"enable_plugin {name} git://git.openstack.org/openstack/{name}" # Keep localrc to be able to set some vars in post_test_hook export KEEP_LOCALRC=1 # Run a minimum set of services services=rabbit,mysql,dstat,key services+=,n-api,n-cpu,n-cond,n-sch,n-crt services+=,g-api,g-reg services+=,c-sch,c-api,c-vol,c-bak services+=,q-svc,q-dhcp,q-meta,q-agt,q-l3 export OVERRIDE_ENABLED_SERVICES=$services if [[ -f "$BASE/new/{name}/contrib/pre_test_hook.sh" ]]; then function pre_test_hook {{ source $BASE/new/{name}/contrib/pre_test_hook.sh }} export -f pre_test_hook fi if [[ -f "$BASE/new/{name}/contrib/gate_hook.sh" ]]; then function gate_hook {{ source $BASE/new/{name}/contrib/gate_hook.sh }} export -f gate_hook fi if [[ -f "$BASE/new/{name}/contrib/post_test_hook.sh" ]]; then function post_test_hook {{ source $BASE/new/{name}/contrib/post_test_hook.sh '{suite}' }} export -f post_test_hook fi
deleted_lines: export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG="enable_plugin {name} git://git.openstack.org/openstack/{name}" function pre_test_hook {{ source $BASE/new/{name}/contrib/pre_test_hook.sh }} export -f pre_test_hook function gate_hook {{ source $BASE/new/{name}/contrib/gate_hook.sh }} export -f gate_hook function post_test_hook {{ source $BASE/new/{name}/contrib/post_test_hook.sh '{suite}' }} export -f post_test_hook

subject: Explicitly list neutron api extensions for tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-30 03:30:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas/commit/75b4ec830435e6905294e28b64d39254239ca84d', 'message': 'Explicitly list neutron api extensions for tests

Recent changes to neutron and gate hooks can cause the api extension
list to not include "all" but a neutron specific list.  This means
lbaasv2 may not be included in api extension list.  This will cause
tempest to skip the neutron-lbaas tests.

commit_message:
Explicitly list neutron api extensions for tests

Recent changes to neutron and gate hooks can cause the api extension
list to not include "all" but a neutron specific list.  This means
lbaasv2 may not be included in api extension list.  This will cause
tempest to skip the neutron-lbaas tests.

This change explictly adds "all,lbaasv2" for the network extensions.

Change-Id: I3836562363e9b66a8173b1c73e2538e2ce2a4922
(cherry picked from commit 5d523cf3b859c088ed908492b9112d10ca4eaf23)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas refs/changes/37/451637/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: NETWORK_API_EXTENSIONS="all,lbaasv2"

subject: Stop using config option sqlite_db
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-09 12:14:51.000000000', 'files': ['congress/common/config.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/congress/commit/b96e50e762bfafdd54ec692fc8974fef72d6f758', 'message': 'Stop using config option sqlite_db

Config option sqlite_db is deprecated
in 0a1bae9859079fb21a03716be947c5f1da6db0a2, and now we use database
with sqlite in memory mode[1] like this: CONF.set_default('connection',
"sqlite://", group='database')so don't need use config option sqlite_db
any more and override its default value.

[1]http://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/rel_1_0/core/engines.html#sqlite

Change-Id: Ic7ef914757b0613ea7209a893fad126b5a6c00a1
'}]
commit_message:
Stop using config option sqlite_db

Config option sqlite_db is deprecated
in 0a1bae9859079fb21a03716be947c5f1da6db0a2, and now we use database
with sqlite in memory mode[1] like this: CONF.set_default('connection',
"sqlite://", group='database')so don't need use config option sqlite_db
any more and override its default value.

[1]http://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/rel_1_0/core/engines.html#sqlite

Change-Id: Ic7ef914757b0613ea7209a893fad126b5a6c00a1

commit_message:
VMAX driver - Live Migration is dropping connection

When Live migrating from one compute node to another the connection
drops and requires the instance to be rebooted. To prevent this
from happening we need to share the storage group and port group
between masking views.

Change-Id: I1483ca38362c5ff1724940c2abf1179e75e02c8e
Closes-Bug: #1676459

deleted_lines: import osfrom oslo_serialization import jsonutils def insert_live_migration_record(self, volume, maskingviewdict, connector, extraSpecs): """Insert a record of live migration destination into a temporary file :param volume: the volume dictionary :param maskingviewdict: the storage group instance name :param connector: the connector Object :param extraSpecs: the extraSpecs dict """ live_migration_details = self.get_live_migration_record(volume, True) if live_migration_details: if volume['id'] not in live_migration_details: live_migration_details[volume['id']] = [maskingviewdict, connector, extraSpecs] else: live_migration_details = {volume['id']: [maskingviewdict, connector, extraSpecs]} try: with open(LIVE_MIGRATION_FILE, "w") as f: jsonutils.dump(live_migration_details, f) except Exception: exceptionMessage = (_( "Error in processing live migration file.")) LOG.exception(exceptionMessage) raise exception.VolumeBackendAPIException( data=exceptionMessage) def delete_live_migration_record(self, volume): """Delete record of live migration Delete record of live migration destination from file and if after deletion of record, delete file if empty. :param volume: the volume dictionary """ live_migration_details = self.get_live_migration_record(volume, True) if live_migration_details: if volume['id'] in live_migration_details: del live_migration_details[volume['id']] with open(LIVE_MIGRATION_FILE, "w") as f: jsonutils.dump(live_migration_details, f) else: LOG.debug("%(Volume)s doesn't exist in live migration " "record.", {'Volume': volume['id']}) if not live_migration_details: os.remove(LIVE_MIGRATION_FILE) def get_live_migration_record(self, volume, returnallrecords): """get record of live migration destination from a temporary file :param volume: the volume dictionary :param returnallrecords: if true, return all records in file :returns: returns a single record or all records depending on returnallrecords flag """ returned_record = None if os.path.isfile(LIVE_MIGRATION_FILE): with open(LIVE_MIGRATION_FILE, "rb") as f: live_migration_details = jsonutils.load(f) if returnallrecords: returned_record = live_migration_details else: if volume['id'] in live_migration_details: returned_record = live_migration_details[volume['id']] else: LOG.debug("%(Volume)s doesn't exist in live migration " "record.", {'Volume': volume['id']}) return returned_record

commit_message:
Switch tripleo-ci to use trunk.rdoproject.org repos

This is a similar patch to https://review.openstack.org/452174
We still have this custom code for libvirt devmode, so we need to
change the repo here too. This is a good reminder that we need to
remove this custom code and replace it with a call to the repo-setup
role. This patch addresses the major breakage, but I will post a
follow-up to refactor this.

Change-Id: I4d772756a652448203a74f3ca75cacf4ec0d42b6
Closes-Bug: 1678218

commit_message:
Remove setting nodes as manageable when enabling introspection

After https://review.openstack.org/#/c/440518 it's not longer
required as new command "openstack overcloud node import
instackenv.json" set the nodes in manageable state. Command
is failing with error:

... "manage" can not be performed on node  while it is in state "manageable"

Change-Id: I84e16ce9e72ba4b6b2eba7272413143af11b8d4f

commit_message:
Moved some variable definitions to global scope

As suggested by Sofer Athlan-Guyot in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/437959/

variables that has been reported as undefined during
the execution of the major upgrade script from M to N has been moved to
global scope since are used in more places.

(this fix has proposed before to master, but these scripts has been
deleted so i'm reproposing it to stable/newton where this script
makes sense to exist)

Change-Id: I16af054e7e8db31abe9cea121387a3d744f1c31f
Closes-Bug: #1667731
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/93/446893/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Some global variables that are used throughout the upgrade scripts # Where to backup current database if mysql need to be upgraded MYSQL_BACKUP_DIR=/var/tmp/mysql_upgrade_osp MYSQL_TEMP_UPGRADE_BACKUP_DIR=/var/lib/mysql-temp-upgrade-backup # Spare disk ratio for extra safety MYSQL_BACKUP_SIZE_RATIO=1.2 # the /root/.my.cnf is needed because we set the mysql root # password from liberty onwards BACKUP_FLAGS="--defaults-extra-file=/root/.my.cnf -u root --flush-privileges --all-databases --single-transaction" backup_size=$(mysqldump $BACKUP_FLAGS 2>/dev/null | wc -c)
deleted_lines: # Where to backup current database if mysql need to be upgraded MYSQL_BACKUP_DIR=/var/tmp/mysql_upgrade_osp MYSQL_TEMP_UPGRADE_BACKUP_DIR=/var/lib/mysql-temp-upgrade-backup # Spare disk ratio for extra safety MYSQL_BACKUP_SIZE_RATIO=1.2 # the /root/.my.cnf is needed because we set the mysql root # password from liberty onwards backup_flags="--defaults-extra-file=/root/.my.cnf -u root --flush-privileges --all-databases --single-transaction" backup_size=$(mysqldump $backup_flags 2>/dev/null | wc -c)

subject: Add etcd3gw for tooz (eventlet scenarios)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-30 15:16:46.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/commit/cfd762e6cf6fefcc90be2c28ece0234103d894fa', 'message': 'Add etcd3gw for tooz (eventlet scenarios)

Context:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/114289.html

In I26e57c362e43b3a458cae93d36907d2454677955, we added support
for etcd3. However as mentioned by Jay and others on that review,
grpc has issues with eventlet. So we need an alternative library
for eventlet based services. This is not only for tooz, but other
experiements like os-lively as well which is likely to call etcd3
directly without going through tooz. The new library etcd3gw needs
at least etcd3 3.1.x with the grpc-gateway /v3alpha HTTP API to
work properly.

* Yes, this library is will be maintained by me at:
  https://github.com/dims/etcd3-gateway
* Yes, this library is a very thin wrapper over the RESTful API.
* Yes, this library claims py35 support
* Yes, this library is Apache 2.0, hence compatible
* No, this library is not currently packaged by distros
* No, functionality is not covered by other libraries
* Yes, DLM backed by etcd3 should be default in upcoming releases.

Change-Id: I1abb58a41ea1fadfc6f4861b12b1a01f3f41437d
'}]
commit_message:
Add etcd3gw for tooz (eventlet scenarios)

Context:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/114289.html

In I26e57c362e43b3a458cae93d36907d2454677955, we added support
for etcd3. However as mentioned by Jay and others on that review,
grpc has issues with eventlet. So we need an alternative library
for eventlet based services. This is not only for tooz, but other
experiements like os-lively as well which is likely to call etcd3
directly without going through tooz. The new library etcd3gw needs
at least etcd3 3.1.x with the grpc-gateway /v3alpha HTTP API to
work properly.

* Yes, this library is will be maintained by me at:
  https://github.com/dims/etcd3-gateway
* Yes, this library is a very thin wrapper over the RESTful API.
* Yes, this library claims py35 support
* Yes, this library is Apache 2.0, hence compatible
* No, this library is not currently packaged by distros
* No, functionality is not covered by other libraries
* Yes, DLM backed by etcd3 should be default in upcoming releases.

Change-Id: I1abb58a41ea1fadfc6f4861b12b1a01f3f41437d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/60/451860/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: etcd3gw===0.1.0

subject: Fix Quota error while running tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-28 06:07:26.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/tempest/api/test_revisions.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/a322266ddc5b01295610dfd469161a1fa186dce2', 'message': 'Fix Quota error while running tests

The test methods in the test class create networks and the cleanup
takes place after all tests are run. As such installation specific
default quota (that was e.g. just 10 networks till Pike) may be hit and
tests then fail.

This patch reduces the chance that the quota limit is not hit by
speeding up network resource cleanup (doing it after each test case
completed, not when the whole test class is cleaned up).

Change-Id: I6ba2704c60c77d89e00842e28bece14c64ef98a6
Closes-bug: #1671478
(cherry picked from commit d0af6d736f9078aa124607ee52e10ff96c09eea8)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Quota error while running tests

The test methods in the test class create networks and the cleanup
takes place after all tests are run. As such installation specific
default quota (that was e.g. just 10 networks till Pike) may be hit and
tests then fail.

This patch reduces the chance that the quota limit is not hit by
speeding up network resource cleanup (doing it after each test case
completed, not when the whole test class is cleaned up).

Change-Id: I6ba2704c60c77d89e00842e28bece14c64ef98a6
Closes-bug: #1671478
(cherry picked from commit d0af6d736f9078aa124607ee52e10ff96c09eea8)

commit_message:
Add test to validate multi _ heat stack_status

According to the Heat API docs, there is a status of IN_PROGRESS which
can cause the old code to fail. Add a test that sets that stack_status
so that we ensure we don't regress on splitting the stack_status.

Change-Id: Ibb1143ffd47465d1640f17bf4319425e6db1f4d1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/shade refs/changes/61/452261/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_get_stack_in_progress(self): in_progress = self.stack.copy() in_progress['stack_status'] = 'CREATE_IN_PROGRESS' self.register_uris([ dict(method='GET', uri='{endpoint}/stacks/{name}'.format( endpoint=fakes.ORCHESTRATION_ENDPOINT, name=self.stack_name), status_code=302, headers=dict( location='{endpoint}/stacks/{name}/{id}'.format( endpoint=fakes.ORCHESTRATION_ENDPOINT, id=self.stack_id, name=self.stack_name))), dict(method='GET', uri='{endpoint}/stacks/{name}/{id}'.format( endpoint=fakes.ORCHESTRATION_ENDPOINT, id=self.stack_id, name=self.stack_name), json={"stack": in_progress}), ]) res = self.cloud.get_stack(self.stack_name) self.assertIsNotNone(res) self.assertEqual(in_progress['stack_name'], res['stack_name']) self.assertEqual(in_progress['stack_name'], res['name']) self.assertEqual(in_progress['stack_status'], res['stack_status']) self.assertEqual('CREATE', res['action']) self.assertEqual('IN_PROGRESS', res['status']) self.assert_calls()

Separating tosca driver out from VNFM

This patch is expected to have the separation of tosca driver
in the future.

Implements blueprint: #tosca-engine

commit_message:
_get_os_distrib() can return 'redhat', add mapping

The unified function returns simply 'redhat' and not 'redhatenterpriselinux'
when executed against RHEL systems. Add the mapping to enable few
validations and other operations.

Change-Id: Ifcc85703a788d2960d20792d817a490f382c1f88

commit_message:
Stop openstack-nova-compute during nova-ironic upgrade

This change ensures that that openstack-nova-compute is
stopped and disabled during the upgrade process.

Closes-Bug: 1675814

Change-Id: Ifd2557b11e4317f1e76e459e8de4162116578eff
(cherry picked from commit 276aca7a8145570301e566a8fb3253f57601d171)

commit_message:
Reload service files on Nova services restart

During an upgrade new service files are added, but systemd is not
reloaded during restart of nova services to pick up these file
changes. This performs a daemon-reload when restarting nova
services.

Change-Id: I98b3f66429ee045f052ad491847cf82d2f5d4efc
Closes-Bug: #1673889

commit_message:
Fix some format error in docstrings

Probably the most common format for documenting arguments is reST field
lists [1]. This change updates some docstrings to comply with the field
lists syntax.

[1] http://sphinx-doc.org/domains.html#info-field-lists

Change-Id: I0fe2d2faa7a1abd6d5e84f05e7fdbb13661a94dc

commit_message:
Refactor identity v3 rbac_base to use classmethods.

Currently, identity v3 rbac_base uses self.addCleanup to do cleanup
for the resources it creates. But this locks the tests into using
only test-level resources. This is inefficient. Instead,
class-level resources should be used wherever possible.

This patch changes the identity v3 rbac_base to create class-level
resources, that are then set up in resource_setup and cleaned up
in resource_cleanup.

This patch also refactors test_roles_rbac in identity v3 to work
with these changes.

Change-Id: I80f56464a9391e0e41548b266e9b748bf961e1b6

subject: [Gate fix] Fixes import big zip file test.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-30 15:25:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/murano-dashboard/commit/a89bfedd2666aa583e6d5f5cd0123523cf9417d0', 'message': '[Gate fix] Fixes import big zip file test.

Currently, the Selenium test test_import_big_zip_file_negative
is throwing an error, because the wrong error message is expected [0].

New: Error: 400 Bad Request: ... (with colon)

This patch also adds a positive test case that checks whether a
regular zip file can be successfully imported.

[0] https://murano-ci.mirantis.com/logs/69/448369/2/check/gate-murano-client-ubuntu/77f533a/

commit_message:
[Gate fix] Fixes import big zip file test.

Currently, the Selenium test test_import_big_zip_file_negative
is throwing an error, because the wrong error message is expected [0].

Old: Error: 400 Bad Request ... (no colon)
New: Error: 400 Bad Request: ... (with colon)

This patch also adds a positive test case that checks whether a
regular zip file can be successfully imported.

[0] https://murano-ci.mirantis.com/logs/69/448369/2/check/gate-murano-client-ubuntu/77f533a/

Change-Id: I874841ec5814edf6935f6ac3a66fe5a14d1e1c15

commit_message:
Switch tripleo-ci master to use promoted repos from trunk.rdoproject.org

CDN sync is broken:
https://bugs.centos.org/view.php?id=12994

Let's use the repo from rdoproject.org, less reliable but temporary
until CDN works.

We're also working on using mirrors from OpenStack Infra, so this patch
is temporary for a few days, it should be ok.

Change-Id: I767bed62d1f0a1b44ee5c2c993338723aae6e71a

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-30 18:05:37.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/quota/test_resource.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/8a0faef877a18d931178a2ed1d55734aa91e32d3', 'message': "TestTrackedResource: register core plugin in directory

This is achieved by switching the test class to BaseTestCase and using
setup_coreplugin. This makes later calls to neutron.objects.db.api
functions that extract the plugin from plugins directory to work.

The test class registers some sqlalchemy events for models not
registered in BASEV2, which later makes unregister_events fail because
of failure to compare those model classes with other registered model
classes (those that belong to proper model classes like Port). Before
the patch, the core plugin was not correctly registered in plugins
directory, and no code was actually loading the plugin, so no other
sqla events were in _REGISTERED_SQLA_EVENTS, which explains why
previously calls to unregister_events hasn't failed.

Good news is that the new parent class does clean up all events itself,
so we don't need to set the cleanup hook ourselves.

This switch also facilitated removal of some other preparatory steps
from the class that are already implemented in the new parent.

Closes-Bug: #1677636
Change-Id: Id462e532066ac3cd5e2f76c3670da7f7820c6581
"}]
commit_message:
TestTrackedResource: register core plugin in directory

This is achieved by switching the test class to BaseTestCase and using
setup_coreplugin. This makes later calls to neutron.objects.db.api
functions that extract the plugin from plugins directory to work.

The test class registers some sqlalchemy events for models not
registered in BASEV2, which later makes unregister_events fail because
of failure to compare those model classes with other registered model
classes (those that belong to proper model classes like Port). Before
the patch, the core plugin was not correctly registered in plugins
directory, and no code was actually loading the plugin, so no other
sqla events were in _REGISTERED_SQLA_EVENTS, which explains why
previously calls to unregister_events hasn't failed.

Good news is that the new parent class does clean up all events itself,
so we don't need to set the cleanup hook ourselves.

This switch also facilitated removal of some other preparatory steps
from the class that are already implemented in the new parent.

Closes-Bug: #1677636
Change-Id: Id462e532066ac3cd5e2f76c3670da7f7820c6581
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/34/451934/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Make use of Dict-base including extras explicit

This change replaces the use of DictBase with the ModelDictMixin
for any SQL models that do not contain an extra column and renames
the DictBase to a more descriptive name of ModelDictMixinWithExtras.

A Docstring has been added indicating the continued usage of
ModelDictMixinWithExtras should not be done for any "new"
models.

Change-Id: I9a4767cacf7620e878df70084060f3e43e1318df

commit_message:
Allow the usage of local facts

Ansible could be used with local facts, but we don't create
the ansible local facts folder by default.

This makes possible to use local facts, with no downside.

Change-Id: I258874f8113e2a678b46cd1a9746490f673119b2

commit_message:
Build event stack_name from links

When retrieving events from nested stacks, we used to do a query per
stack and thus get the stack that way. We changed it to do only one API
call, but didn't fix the way the stack name was set. We need to use the
event links to retrieve the stack name, instead of the root stack.

Closes-Bug: #1676896
Change-Id: I09ab1cc2c6aaab02036b124b1dfa561dd6132083
(cherry picked from commit 954e475a6a0a12432ec325d7579460fabcf3f40a)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-heatclient refs/changes/54/451454/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _get_stack_name_from_links(event): links = dict((l.get('rel'), l.get('href')) for l in getattr(event, 'links', [])) href = links.get('stack') if not href: return return href.split('/stacks/', 1)[-1].split('/')[0] stack_name = stack_id.split("/")[0] e.stack_name = _get_stack_name_from_links(e) or stack_name

commit_message:
Lock transfers table on multi-table update

Lock updated row of transfers table until operation
(accept / destroy) of db.api ends.

Implements: blueprint cinder-volume-active-active-support
Change-Id: I5c6573ad37a8a74ca59f7a6f491b788892e55b30

commit_message:
api-ref: fix description of volumeAttachment for attach/swap-volume

The description of the volumeAttachment request parameter was actually
the description of the response parameter, which included more fields
than we allow on the POST and PUT requests for os-volume_attachments.

This fixes the descriptions for both POST and PUT and also includes a
tiny fix for the wording on the existing volumeAttachment parameter.

Change-Id: I4ccd4ac12e24b232925875fdb5fb568c2bfaf417
Closes-Bug: #1675536
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/02/449302/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # This is the volumeAttachment in a response body. A dictionary representation of a volume attachment containing the fields ``device``, ``id``, ``serverId`` and ``volumeId``. in: body required: true type: object # This is the volumeAttachment in a POST (attach volume) request body. volumeAttachment_post: description: | A dictionary representation of a volume attachment containing the fields ``device`` and ``volumeId``. in: body required: true type: object # This is the volumeAttachment in a PUT (swap volume) request body. volumeAttachment_put: description: | A dictionary representation of a volume attachment containing the field ``volumeId``.
deleted_lines: A dictionary representation of a volume attachment containing the fields, ``device``, ``id``, ``serverId``, ``volumeId``.

commit_message:
Handle empty body in add_router_interface

when passing an empty dict body {} to add_router_interface[1], internal
server error will be raised.
There is argument check in the cli which checks either subnet or port id
is needed, but not in the server side when the body is empty.

[1]:
https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/networking/v2/?expanded=add-interface-to-router-detail

Change-Id: Iad48dadb1235bc45787a1e87ff3f0d7a21df18af
Closes-bug: #1674069

deleted_lines: def add_router_interface(self, context, router_id, interface_info): def add_router_interface(self, context, router_id, interface_info): context, router_id, interface_info)

commit_message:
dynamically determine api attrs/resources/aliases

Rather than statically defining the API resource, attribute
and extension alias names, why not use the list of all API
definitions we already have to build them. This will make
life easier as we move new api-defs into lib.

Note these changes indirectly tested via that fact that our
existing api-def test cases continue to pass.

Change-Id: I9b2cb9b36432c6c83471f44272679aab91c9928c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib refs/changes/93/452293/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron_lib.api import definitions def _defined_resources(): """Builds and returns a tuple of all known resource names.""" resource_names = [] for api_def in definitions._ALL_API_DEFINITIONS: resource_names.extend(api_def.RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP.keys()) return tuple(set(resource_names)) def _defined_attributes(): """Builds and returns a tuple of all known resource attribute names.""" attribute_names = [] for api_def in definitions._ALL_API_DEFINITIONS: for attr_maps in api_def.RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP.values(): attribute_names.extend(attr_maps.keys()) return tuple(set(attribute_names)) def _defined_extension_aliases(): """Builds and returns a tuple of all known extension aliases.""" return tuple(set([r.ALIAS for r in definitions._ALL_API_DEFINITIONS])) KNOWN_ATTRIBUTES = _defined_attributes() KNOWN_RESOURCES = _defined_resources()KNOWN_EXTENSIONS = tuple(set(_defined_extension_aliases()) | set([ # not yet defined in neutron-lib.api.definitions]))

commit_message:
Adding functionality in openstack client to list volumes associated
with no project or an invalid project id that no longer exists.

Change-Id: I536f0d76a7cfc228b73d447edf625fbdf8f33011
Implements: blueprint openstackclient-orphan-volumes-list

added_lines: "--no-project-id", action='store_true', help=_("Show all volumes that are not assigned to a " "specific project id.") ) parser.add_argument( "--orphaned-project-id", action='store_true', help=_("Show all volumes that are owned by an orphaned " "project id that no longer exists.") ) parser.add_argument( def filter_items(items, removed_items): deleted_items = [] for item in items: if item in removed_items: deleted_items.append(item) return [s for s in items if s not in deleted_items] if parsed_args.no_project_id: search_opts = { 'all_tenants': True } data = volume_client.volumes.list( search_opts=search_opts, marker=parsed_args.marker, limit=parsed_args.limit, ) removed_items = [] for s in data: project_id = getattr(s, "os-vol-tenant-attr:tenant_id", None) if len(project_id) > 0: removed_items.append(s) data = filter_items(data, removed_items) if parsed_args.orphaned_project_id: search_opts = { 'all_tenants': True } project_ids = [] project_data = identity_client.projects.list() for p in project_data: project_ids.append(p.id) data = volume_client.volumes.list( search_opts=search_opts, marker=parsed_args.marker, limit=parsed_args.limit, ) removed_items = [] for s in data: project_id = getattr(s, "os-vol-tenant-attr:tenant_id", None) if project_id in project_ids or len(project_id) < 1: removed_items.append(s) data = filter_items(data, removed_items)

commit_message:
Fix previous patch for skipping heat

The previous patch to skip heat unless it is installed failed to
load the credentials and does not work for that reason.

This patch fixes the problem.

Change-Id: Ic95ef64a1c084a23928e6af848cf15f6484d1d6b

commit_message:
Short circuit notifications when not enabled

Wasting time on generating the payload of the notifications is
unnecessary if the notification will not be emitted due to
configuration.

This patch depends on an oslo messaging improvement that adds
a way to check if a Notifier will emit the notification or not.

Depends-On: Ib992f5c20fef85224fb00823e1d8d9c6cff19bec
Depends-On: I979fb3385671aba6f4162ef991da8f0febe0068a

Change-Id: I3e6741d59df49e1e58409314008c2ed609fdedc1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/60/428260/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def notifications_enabled_in_oslo(conf): """Check if oslo notifications are enabled.""" notifications_driver = set(conf.oslo_messaging_notifications.driver) return notifications_driver and notifications_driver != {'noop'} def versioned_notifications_enabled(conf): """Check if versioned notifications are enabled.""" return conf.notifications.notification_format in ('both', 'versioned') def if_notifications_enabled(f): """Calls decorated method only if versioned notifications are enabled.""" @functools.wraps(f) def wrapped(*args, **kwargs): if (notifications_enabled_in_oslo(CONF) and versioned_notifications_enabled(CONF)): return f(*args, **kwargs) return None return wrapped

commit_message:
Add os-traits reference

As an developer/cloud admin, while reading the spec, I may be
interested in the 'os-traits' library, as 'standard traits' are
defined in it and I would like to know whats in it,  it would
be better to provide a reference link to it instead of searching
it on internet.

Change-Id: Id3c28810420fd09761938efd674476c4329a7ab6

Move heat config to kolla-kubernetes

Another role moved

added_lines: --- - name: Ensuring config directories exist file: path: "{{ node_config_directory }}/{{ item.key }}" state: "directory" recurse: yes when: - item.value.enabled | bool with_dict: "{{ heat_services }}" - name: Copying over config.json files for services template: src: "{{ item.key }}.json.j2" dest: "{{ node_config_directory }}/{{ item.key }}/config.json" register: heat_config_jsons when: - item.value.enabled | bool with_dict: "{{ heat_services }}" - name: Copying over the heat-engine environment file template: src: "_deprecated.yaml" dest: "{{ node_config_directory }}/{{ item }}/_deprecated.yaml" with_items: - "heat-engine" - name: Copying over heat.conf merge_configs: vars: service_name: "{{ item.key }}" sources: - "{{ role_path }}/templates/heat.conf.j2" - "{{ node_custom_config }}/global.conf" - "{{ node_custom_config }}/database.conf" - "{{ node_custom_config }}/messaging.conf" - "{{ node_custom_config }}/heat.conf" - "{{ node_custom_config }}/heat/{{ item.key }}.conf" - "{{ node_custom_config }}/heat/{{ inventory_hostname }}/heat.conf" dest: "{{ node_config_directory }}/{{ item.key }}/heat.conf" register: heat_confs when: - item.value.enabled | bool with_dict: "{{ heat_services }}" - name: Check if policies shall be overwritten local_action: stat path="{{ node_custom_config }}/heat/policy.json" register: heat_policy - name: Copying over existing policy.json template: src: "{{ node_custom_config }}/heat/policy.json" dest: "{{ node_config_directory }}/{{ item.key }}/policy.json" register: heat_policy_jsons when: - heat_policy.stat.exists with_dict: "{{ heat_services }}"

commit_message:
Use job-template check-requirements in masakari projects

This patch proposes to use 'check-requirements' job-template for
masakari, masakari-monitors and python-masakariclient.
The patch to add those projects to the sync list is
I7108d723a088ecabfddf883f4499b7aece106592.

Partially-Implements: blueprint enable-openstack-proposal-bot
Change-Id: I326d54369e3ffe5b7b4968ecf7e187762bd7dd4f

commit_message:
[rally] Add support for custom branching

To support custom branching, we need to setup features matrix file.

The proper change to master branch of Rally was merged[1]. The change for
stable/0.9[2] (our first custom branch) will be merged as soon as gates will
allow it (it is impossible without merging change to project-config).

[1] - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/450344/
[2] - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/450490/

Change-Id: I7c5385551bf1284140696a9ec9d03bd9b929c477

commit_message:
Re-Add bigswitch agent support

The agent configuration was lost in newton during the puppet-tripleo and
THT role conversion. This change adds support for including the bigswitch
agent service for composable roles.

Change-Id: I46896389e48cdbe2864bf5b609a786f1c84ef908
Closes-Bug: #1673126
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/29/446029/13 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: heat_template_version: ocata description: > Installs bigswitch agent parameters: ServiceNetMap: default: {} description: Mapping of service_name -> network name. Typically set via parameter_defaults in the resource registry. This mapping overrides those in ServiceNetMapDefaults. type: json DefaultPasswords: default: {} type: json EndpointMap: default: {} description: Mapping of service endpoint -> protocol. Typically set via parameter_defaults in the resource registry. type: json outputs: role_data: description: bigswitch agent value: service_name: step_config: | if hiera('step') >= 4 { include ::neutron::agents::bigswitch }

commit_message:
Make conductor ask scheduler to limit migrates to same cell

This makes changes to the host manager to collect information
about the cell that a particular HostState is in, and makes
FilterScheduler and CachingScheduler properly filter for a
requested cell when appropriate.

Related to blueprint cells-aware-api
Change-Id: Ic6dc46183676a91cf9037726316b677a29e2d342
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/25/438025/32 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _get_computes_all_cells(self, context, compute_uuids=None, spec_obj=None): if (spec_obj and 'requested_destination' in spec_obj and 'cell' in spec_obj.requested_destination): only_cell = spec_obj.destination.cell else: only_cell = None for cell in self.cells: if only_cell and cell.uuid != only_cell.uuid: LOG.debug('Skipping nonlocal cell %(cell)s', {'cell': cell}) continue def get_host_states_by_uuids(self, context, compute_uuids, spec_obj): compute_nodes, services = self._get_computes_all_cells( context, compute_uuids=compute_uuids, spec_obj=spec_obj)
deleted_lines: def _get_computes_all_cells(self, context, compute_uuids=None): for cell in self.cells: def get_host_states_by_uuids(self, context, compute_uuids): compute_nodes, services = self._get_computes_all_cells(context, compute_uuids)

commit_message:
No need for a upgrade field on composable upgrade workaround.

The user isn't required to do anything to have this work.  As I
understand this field from
https://docs.openstack.org/developer/reno/usage.html it's only useful
when you dictate some manual steps implied by the change.

Change-Id: Ic95826907bf0e07707df257966635e05d809d39c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/41/452241/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: upgrade: - Added to the ansible steps with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/434346/ and minor update/manual upgrade nodes with /#/c/450607/

commit_message:
Added Galera SSL support

MySQL SSL connections allowed. Self-signed SSL CA cert or user-provided
CA certificate delivered from the deployment host.

Change-Id: Iaa07435357139133e325d85808b419e8c55b5e50
Partial-Bug: #1667789
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-galera_client refs/changes/43/448743/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # SSL support galera_use_ssl: false # The folder on the deployment host with self-signed CA stored galera_self_signed_dir: /etc/openstack_deploy/files/self-signed-certs # Full path to the self-signed cert on the deployment host galera_self_ca_cert_path: "{{galera_self_signed_dir}}"/galera-ca.pem # The path where to store the database server CA certificate galera_ssl_ca_cert: /etc/ssl/certs/galera-ca.crt # The path to a user-provided Galera CA certificate file on the deployment host #galera_user_ssl_ca_cert: /etc/openstack_deploy/files/galera-ca.crt

charms capable of relating to ceph build the list of monitor hosts
from the ceph-public-address in the relation data or simply using the
private-address field provided by juju.

list of monitor hosts provided in the configuration, so clients connect
directly to the non juju managed ceph and not to ceph-proxy IP.

commit_message:
Set ceph-public-address with monitor-hosts config

charms capable of relating to ceph build the list of monitor hosts
from the ceph-public-address in the relation data or simply using the
private-address field provided by juju.

This patch populates ceph-public-address in the relations with the
list of monitor hosts provided in the configuration, so clients connect
directly to the non juju managed ceph and not to ceph-proxy IP.

Closes-Bug: #1642430
Change-Id: Ib2e3c6a8b0d9fc0b6d729d845a802945b64fc74c

added_lines: import mock import sys # python-apt is not installed as part of test-requirements but is imported by # some charmhelpers modules so create a fake import. mock_apt = mock.MagicMock() sys.modules['apt'] = mock_apt mock_apt.apt_pkg = mock.MagicMock() mock_apt_pkg = mock.MagicMock() sys.modules['apt_pkg'] = mock_apt_pkg mock_apt_pkg.upstream_version = mock.MagicMock() mock_apt_pkg.upstream_version.return_value = '10.1.2-0ubuntu1' import test_utils import ceph_hooks as hooks CEPH_KEY = 'AQDmP6dYWto6AhAAPKMkuvdFZYPRaiboU27IsA==' CEPH_GET_KEY = """[client.admin] key = %s caps mds = "allow *" caps mon = "allow *" caps osd = "allow *" """ % CEPH_KEY TO_PATCH = [ 'config', 'install_alternative', 'mkdir', 'related_units', 'relation_get', 'relation_ids', 'relation_set', 'remote_unit', 'render', 'service_name', 'log' ] def fake_log(message, level=None): print("juju-log %s: %s" % (level, message)) class TestHooks(test_utils.CharmTestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestHooks, self).setUp(hooks, TO_PATCH) self.service_name.return_value = 'ceph-service' self.config.side_effect = lambda x: self.test_config.get(x) self.remote_unit.return_value = 'client/0' self.log.side_effect = fake_log @mock.patch('subprocess.check_output') def test_radosgw_realtion(self, mock_check_output): settings = {'ceph-public-address': '127.0.0.1:1234 [::1]:4321', 'radosgw_key': CEPH_KEY, 'auth': 'cephx', 'fsid': 'some-fsid'} mock_check_output.return_value = CEPH_GET_KEY self.relation_get.return_value = {} self.test_config.set('monitor-hosts', settings['ceph-public-address']) self.test_config.set('fsid', settings['fsid']) self.test_config.set('admin-key', 'some-admin-key') hooks.radosgw_relation() self.relation_set.assert_called_with(relation_id=None, relation_settings=settings) @mock.patch('ceph.ceph_user') @mock.patch.object(hooks, 'radosgw_relation') @mock.patch.object(hooks, 'client_relation_joined') def test_emit_cephconf(self, mock_client_rel, mock_rgw_rel, mock_ceph_user): mock_ceph_user.return_value = 'ceph-user' self.test_config.set('monitor-hosts', '127.0.0.1:1234') self.test_config.set('fsid', 'abc123') self.test_config.set('admin-key', 'key123') def c(k): x = {'radosgw': ['rados:1'], 'client': ['client:1'], 'rados:1': ['rados/1']} return x[k] self.relation_ids.side_effect = c self.related_units.side_effect = c hooks.emit_cephconf() context = {'auth_supported': self.test_config.get('auth-supported'), 'mon_hosts': self.test_config.get('monitor-hosts'), 'fsid': self.test_config.get('fsid'), 'use_syslog': str(self.test_config.get( 'use-syslog')).lower(), 'loglevel': self.test_config.get('loglevel')} dirname = '/var/lib/charm/ceph-service' self.mkdir.assert_called_with(dirname, owner='ceph-user', group='ceph-user') self.render.assert_any_call('ceph.conf', '%s/ceph.conf' % dirname, context, perms=0o644) self.install_alternative.assert_called_with('ceph.conf', '/etc/ceph/ceph.conf', '%s/ceph.conf' % dirname, 100) keyring = 'ceph.client.admin.keyring' context = {'admin_key': self.test_config.get('admin-key')} self.render.assert_any_call(keyring, '/etc/ceph/' + keyring, context, owner='ceph-user', perms=0o600) mock_rgw_rel.assert_called_with(relid='rados:1', unit='rados/1') mock_client_rel.assert_called_with('client:1') @mock.patch('subprocess.check_output') def test_client_relation_joined(self, mock_check_output): mock_check_output.return_value = CEPH_GET_KEY self.test_config.set('monitor-hosts', '127.0.0.1:1234') self.test_config.set('fsid', 'abc123') self.test_config.set('admin-key', 'some-admin-key') self.related_units.return_value = ['client/0'] hooks.client_relation_joined('client:1') data = {'key': CEPH_KEY, 'auth': 'cephx', 'ceph-public-address': self.test_config.get('monitor-hosts')} self.relation_set.assert_called_with(relation_id='client:1', relation_settings=data)

commit_message:
Update release note for ovs manual upgrade

Adding in a separate review to not charge the CI

Change-Id: I23b066c02648b95558d7f9affa839d3172050c8f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/36/452236/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - During the ovs upgrade for 2.5 to 2.6 we need to workaround the classic yum update command by handling the upgrade of the package separately to not loose the IPs and the connectivity on the nodes. The workaround is discussed here https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1669714
deleted_lines: - As discussed in https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1669714 we need to carry the special case ovs upgrade for 2.5-2.6 as part of the ansible upgrades steps.

commit_message:
Add env_file for docker hook

Add docker hook for environment files.
Some containerized services need to accept environment
files and cannot be configured otherwise, for example
Etcd key-value storage.

Partial-bug: #1668938

Change-Id: I228b5f9ee67215ae742760d449b9cd8a4b9543d0
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-agents refs/changes/23/447623/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if 'environment_file' in cconfig: cmd.append('--env-file=%s' % cconfig['environment_file'])

commit_message:
Fix api-ref for adminPass behavior

This commit fix the below doc issue for adminPass
 -'adminPass' attrbiure is only return in response if
  'enable_instance_password' configuration option is set to true
 - evacuate API stop returning adminPass from 2.14 microversion
   so max version for this field is 2.13.
 - if 'adminPass' is not present in request then, operation auto generate one.

Change-Id: I636657ed30b33da0a2df73b222c4ce5d8388a3d8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/50/449450/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - adminPass: adminPass_response

commit_message:
Correct invalid param in create_volume

There is no argument named "param" in create_volume, besides,
name is not necessary in create_volume(if name is not passed in,
the volume can reach status available with name=null), so this
is to remove param in create_volume in negative tests.

Change-Id: I7e0ed8be728825ca340be584e1dfe0cc5a8dbff5

commit_message:
Fix for Group API update to include check policy

All cinder APIs should do policy checks to enforce
role based access controls. All group apis except
groups update has this in place. This changeset
adds policy check for the update groups api.

Change-Id: I66ea25f972eb8ba43ab7233b6c6a1abc503a66fd
Closes-Bug: 1676278
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/74/451974/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix panko-dbsync container command

The command parameter expects an array. When a string is passed instead,
it is treated like an array of characters, resulting in docker receiving
this Cmd:

            "Cmd": [
                "/",
                "u",
                "s",
                "r",
                "/",
                "b",
                "i",
                "n",
                "/",
                "p",
                "a",
                "n",
                "k",
                "o",
                "-",
                "d",
                "b",
                "s",
                "y",
                "n",
                "c"
            ],

This is now fixed by making the string into a single-item array.

commit_message:
add backoff logic

this adds some logic to decide whether to delay or skip scheduling
based on remaining job queue and how much was scheduled previously.

Change-Id: I61868252604b53d3de97866f825039e60ad7f1c2
Closes-Bug: #1620674
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi refs/changes/16/449316/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.prev_sched = 0 if self._skip_scheduling: return self.prev_sched = count / self.BLOCK_SIZE def _skip_scheduling(self): """Check whether to alter scheduling Safety check to see if we're scheduling too frequently for processors. Checks existing job queue size compared to previously scheduled load. if >55% remains, skip scheduling, else delay if needed. """ if self.prev_sched: qsize = self.queue.qsize time_left = qsize / ((self.prev_sched - qsize) / self.interval_delay) if time_left / self.interval_delay > 0.55: LOG.warning('Skipping scheduling cycle. Please increase ' 'workers or scheduling interval') return True elif time_left / self.interval_delay > 0.1: LOG.warning('Delaying scheduling cycle. Please increase ' 'workers or scheduling interval') time.sleep(time_left) return False

commit_message:
query sacks concurrently

we should process sacks concurrently since it's all I/O.

Change-Id: I2dcbc66331c40b4e98db48bc874491e63cd40f00
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi refs/changes/84/449284/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from concurrent import futures # set to 1/4 the number of workers since scheduling < processing self.scheduling_threads = (self.conf.metricd.workers - 1 // 4) + 1 tasks = self._get_tasks() with futures.ThreadPoolExecutor( max_workers=self.scheduling_threads) as executor: count = sum(executor.map(self._schedule, tasks)) def _schedule(self, sack): count = 0 metrics = list( self.store.incoming.list_metric_with_measures_to_process(sack)) count += len(metrics) for i in six.moves.range(0, len(metrics), self.BLOCK_SIZE): self.queue.put(metrics[i:i + self.BLOCK_SIZE]) return count
deleted_lines: for sack in self._get_tasks(): metrics = list( self.store.incoming.list_metric_with_measures_to_process( sack)) count += len(metrics) for i in six.moves.range(0, len(metrics), self.BLOCK_SIZE): self.queue.put(metrics[i:i + self.BLOCK_SIZE])

commit_message:
use tooz partitioner

use tooz partitioner to grab sacks to process. we save hashring node
details so we only need to recompute tasks if changed.

Change-Id: Ie99eaf5ed2cff863b6e9ce38f16743e925529ac6

commit_message:
Add description to policies in services.py

The 'discoverable' policy is not documented as it will be removed in a
future change.

blueprint policy-docs

Change-Id: Iff6793d90c9977566a2b42c2ca4e1fd50591b737

commit_message:
Add functional job for k8s-cloud-provider with sudo privileges

In k8s-cloud-provider functional job, we need to sudo
perms to setup docker, start kubernetes and run end-to-end
tests.

Change-Id: I21ae844b54602b0ad7322d72d2e63fca05dc3a95

Add bandit-baseline to tox.ini

To add a bandit gate, a new tox environment is needed

commit_message:
Fix requirements checkout on buildimage

The current zuul-git-prep-upper-constraints macro
was giving conflict with the pre-existing checkout one. As
both do the clone of the checked project, it was giving
an error on git, because the directory already existed.
Adding openstack/requirements to the clonemap instead

Change-Id: I36273f59c052dd2fd5c3e870ee7802a1bdcf47e7

commit_message:
Check only preservation of config after cluster reset

After the reworking of feature "Openstack config"
we can apply a new config only for pre-defined role.
That's a reason to change a logic of the test

commit_message:
Add a DSVM job for golang projects

k8s-cloud-provider is an external driver for kubernetes. So
so to test code in this repo, we need to stand up a working
devstack environment, run etcd and kubernetes with proper
configuration and run kubernetes with the --cloud-provider
option pointing to our driver. Then we can run a bunch of
e2e tests say for example to test cinder integration. Any
repo that wants to use this job will need to have a devstack
plugin defined and the shell scripts for the hooks need
to be present in their proper location.

Change-Id: I03451816e2db66fbffc57a5de570f1505080bc0d

commit_message:
Add ironic sudoers file to binary packages as well

When built as binary packages Ironic conductor would
fail to start due to a new 'sudo modprobe iscsi_tcp' command
added in 05c0d6998bdda155c925d563b75ac353303f93ff

Change-Id: I74ebbc2ec612e1068ac82225dc79e9ee0b6c23f4
Closes-bug: #1676466

commit_message:
Handle log message interpolation by the logger

According to OpenStack Guideline[1], logged string message should be
interpolated by the logger.

[1]: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#adding-variables-to-log-messages
Change-Id: I51f50935f1eeffe4960562d6309dfdf05814e595
Closes-Bug: #1596829

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-21 13:08:58.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/router_info.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/dvr_edge_router.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/de7a472b1b11d37350c8905b41ab2b5987bfd9e7', 'message': 'WIP: Floating IPs support in a DVR SNAT namespace

For the cases when Floating IPs need to be handled on a network node:

commit_message:
WIP: Floating IPs support in a DVR SNAT namespace

For the cases when Floating IPs need to be handled on a network node:
like for allowed address pairs ports, or in case no public connectivity
on compiute nodes.
The patch tries to reuse floating ip processing code of legacy routers
but using snat namespace instead of legacy router namespace.

Partial-Bug: #1583694
Change-Id: Iaca330553fa68a968a006f8d084c920d0ac3201f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/84/448084/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron.agent.l3 import legacy_routerfrom neutron.common import constants as n_const # Floating IP processing # DVR Edge router will handle Floating IPs in a centralized manner if required # ============================================================================ def get_floating_ips(self): """Filter Floating IPs to be hosted on this agent.""" floating_ips = self.router.get(lib_constants.FLOATINGIP_KEY, []) return [fip for fip in floating_ips if fip[n_const.DVR_SNAT_BOUND]] def get_floating_ips_iptables_manager(self): return self.snat_iptables_manager def get_floating_ips_namespace_name(self): return self.snat_namespace.name def add_floating_ip(self, fip, interface_name, device): return legacy_router.LegacyRouter.add_floating_ip( self, fip, interface_name, device) def move_floating_ip(self, fip): return legacy_router.LegacyRouter.move_floating_ip(self, fip) def remove_floating_ip(self, device, ip_cidr): return legacy_router.LegacyRouter.remove_floating_ip( self, device, ip_cidr)

commit_message:
Removal of mysql codebock from common_prerequisites.rst

Usage of code-block:: mysql causes an error with newer
sphinx installations. This change modifies the mysql to
none to avoid these errors.

Change-Id: Ie5d79e4f26373d2901405aace3c79bc5b3a48d36
Signed-off-by: csatari <gergely.csatari@nokia.com>

commit_message:
Do not use ip (from iproute2) and route (form net-tools)

    scripts, as these aren't essential packages.

Change-Id: Id1e0a762e754e562309ccf1e16e5bd0d0400fe3b

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-28 01:47:27.000000000', 'files': ['os_client_config/cloud_config.py', 'os_client_config/tests/test_cloud_config.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-client-config/commit/aa15e3686d4b634e48d585368d1987bddd438457', 'message': "Add allow_identity_admin to CloudConfig.get_session_endpoint()

os-client-config can't get Identity admin endpoint with the method.

For backward compatibility, we have to keep the current behavior of it.
So this commit adds a keyword argument 'allow_identity_admin=False' to

Change-Id: I1bf1fdf6210731b9aa8f314de3725da8eee332eb

commit_message:
Add allow_identity_admin to CloudConfig.get_session_endpoint()

CloudConfig.get_session_endpoint() doesn't return the Identity endpoint
for required interface but one used for user authentication to avoid a
bug of python-keystoneauth. It was already fixed, but programs using
os-client-config can't get Identity admin endpoint with the method.

For backward compatibility, we have to keep the current behavior of it.
So this commit adds a keyword argument 'allow_identity_admin=False' to
it to keep current spec as default and to add capability to return
Identity admin endpoint if 'allow_identity_admin=True' was specified.

Change-Id: I1bf1fdf6210731b9aa8f314de3725da8eee332eb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-client-config refs/changes/00/450500/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_session_endpoint_identity_allow_admin(self, mock_get_session): mock_session = mock.Mock() mock_get_session.return_value = mock_session config_dict = defaults.get_defaults() config_dict.update(fake_services_dict) cc = cloud_config.CloudConfig( "test1", "region-al", config_dict, auth_plugin=mock.Mock()) cc.get_session_endpoint('identity', allow_identity_admin=True) mock_session.get_endpoint.assert_called_with( interface='admin', service_name='locks', region_name='region-al', service_type='identity') @mock.patch.object(cloud_config.CloudConfig, 'get_session')

commit_message:
Update pip in DLRN venv

Newer versions of setuptools require an updated pip to be installed.
Running the --delorean-setup locally is actually failing for me with
(not sure what the difference is compared to CI, but probably is due to
using the infra created CentOS image which has updated pip/virtualenv
already):

ImportError: No module named six.moves

This is an expected problem with newer versions of setuptools per
https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/942#issuecomment-274817619
https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/937

We're already using the latest packaged versions of virtualenv and pip
on CentOS so the fix is to first update pip in the newly created
virtualenv.

Change-Id: Ibc0e266d48dec587c8221f8392f060b58496def4

subject: Ensure failed disk attachments are cleaned up
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-24 16:17:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-win/commit/2b3683326e883f6df7b46180334ada1d7b795d0b', 'message': "[wip - needs UT] Ensure failed disk attachments are cleaned up

When attaching an image to an instance, we first attach a synthetic
disk drive resource, to which we then attach a vhd/iso disk resource.

If the latter fails, the synthetic disk drive remains attached to
the vm.

What makes it worse is that this operation is retried, so we're
ending up with multiple leaked disk resources.

This change ensures we do a proper cleanup in this situation.

Change-Id: I954a4d01f8b7357fda6f5865fdc44055443afbc2
Closes-Bug: #1675834

"}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2017-03-30 16:42:09.000000000', 'files': ['os_win/tests/unit/utils/compute/test_vmutils.py', 'os_win/utils/compute/vmutils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-win/commit/2997b90fbb2a405bce55514fd1cb635b6e6bb03d', 'message': "Ensure failed disk attachments are cleaned up

When attaching an image to an instance, we first attach a synthetic
disk drive resource, to which we then attach a vhd/iso disk resource.

If the latter fails, the synthetic disk drive remains attached to

What makes it worse is that this operation is retried, so we're

commit_message:
Ensure failed disk attachments are cleaned up

When attaching an image to an instance, we first attach a synthetic
disk drive resource, to which we then attach a vhd/iso disk resource.

If the latter fails, the synthetic disk drive remains attached to
the vm.

What makes it worse is that this operation is retried, so we're
ending up with multiple leaked disk resources.

This change ensures we do a proper cleanup in this situation.

Change-Id: I954a4d01f8b7357fda6f5865fdc44055443afbc2
Closes-Bug: #1675834

commit_message:
Remove log translations in scheduler 3/5

Log messages are no longer being translated. This removes all use of
the _LE, _LI, and _LW translation markers to simplify logging and to
avoid confusion with new contributions.
This is the 3/5 commit.
Old commit will be abandoned: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/447822/

See:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2016-November/002574.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html

Change-Id: I0c1dd123ce8d08c797780c7706c684a939371719
Depends-On: I9fd264a443c634465b8548067f86ac14c1a51faa
Partial-Bug: #1674542

commit_message:
Replace uuid.uuid4() with uuidutils.generate_uuid()

As of now, UUID is being generated using either uuid.uuid4()
or uuidutils.generate_uuid(). In order to maintain consistency,
we propose to use uuidutils.generate_uuid() from oslo_utils.

Change-Id: I430875428c2e3e35cb89c8e216dfe02ae2ee7ac7
Closes-bug: #1082248

deleted_lines: import uuid 'backup_name': uuid.uuid4().hex backup_name = uuid.uuid4().hex 'backup_name': uuid.uuid4().hex

commit_message:
Exporting UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE on bifrost

bifrost has been updated to use this var, so exporting
the right env var here, to fix testing for stable
branches.

commit_message:
[N->O] is creating 2 default cell_v2 cells

A side-effect of running map_cell_and_hosts is that a default cell is created
(unless host mappings already exists).
As we are explicitly creating the default cell we need to run discover_hosts
to create the host mappings.

Change-Id: I1a28e9b85a7c43561700faf692248c5fc06b8ad8
Closes-Bug: #1675418
(cherry picked from commit ab4adb9fb1b1ba003a8045ce4c3879f88ea243b3)

commit_message:
[BugFix][Devref] Refactor attach/detach v2 devref

There are some issues around new attach/detach APIs/CLIs,
fix them step by step. Currently the attach/detach dev ref
is out of date and have some format issues.
Refactor attach/detach v2 devref to make it
more readable. This is the original version: [1]

DocImpact
Depends-On: bae8bd017e30425295e03d13b39202a81e923c3e
Closes-Bug: 1675976
[1] https://docs.openstack.org/developer/cinder/devref/attach_detach_conventions_v2.html

Change-Id: I26f8427b38ee08c5da7224df6423956ee9a744d2

commit_message:
Retrieve VM disk attachment info

We're adding a new method that will retrieve information about a
specific VM disk attachment. This will include the disk controller
type, controller slot and controller path.

The Nova driver will use this when placing a disk at a specific
VM location, specifically during Nova assisted volume snapshots.

Change-Id: I58e876ca63d0f8baf46de58ed18fdc98285f30d5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-win refs/changes/11/448611/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_disk_attachment_info(self, attached_disk_path, is_physical=True): res = self._get_mounted_disk_resource_from_path(attached_disk_path, is_physical) if is_physical: drive = res else: drive = self._get_wmi_obj(res.Parent, True) ctrl_slot = int(drive.AddressOnParent) ctrl_path = drive.Parent ctrl_type = self._get_disk_controller_type(ctrl_path) attachment_info = dict(controller_slot=ctrl_slot, controller_path=ctrl_path, controller_type=ctrl_type) return attachment_info def _get_disk_controller_type(self, controller_path): ctrl = self._get_wmi_obj(controller_path, True) res_sub_type = ctrl.ResourceSubType if res_sub_type == self._SCSI_CTRL_RES_SUB_TYPE: return constants.CTRL_TYPE_SCSI elif res_sub_type == self._IDE_CTRL_RES_SUB_TYPE: return constants.CTRL_TYPE_IDE else: err_msg = _("Got unknown resource subtype: '%(res_sub_type)s' " "for disk controller '%(controller_path)s'") raise exceptions.HyperVException( err_msg % dict(res_sub_type=res_sub_type, controller_path=controller_path))

commit_message:
Add upper constraints limitation of buildimage jobs

diskimage-builder is installed via pip, and it's not
considering the upper constraints. This is causing jobs
in stable branches to fail.

Change-Id: Ief5e90c49f122f146fde85e358fa022219f64af7
