git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/90/451990/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: .. _GroupAffinityFilter: GroupAffinityFilter ------------------- .. note:: This filter is deprecated in favor of :ref:`ServerGroupAffinityFilter`. The GroupAffinityFilter ensures that an instance is scheduled on to a host from a set of group hosts. To take advantage of this filter, the requester must pass a scheduler hint, using ``group`` as the key and an arbitrary name as the value. Using the :command:`openstack server create` command, use the ``--hint`` flag. For example: .. code-block:: console $ openstack server create --image IMAGE_ID --flavor 1 \ --hint group=foo server-1 This filter should not be enabled at the same time as :ref:`GroupAntiAffinityFilter` or neither filter will work properly. .. _GroupAntiAffinityFilter: GroupAntiAffinityFilter ----------------------- .. note:: This filter is deprecated in favor of :ref:`ServerGroupAntiAffinityFilter`. The GroupAntiAffinityFilter ensures that each instance in a group is on a different host. To take advantage of this filter, the requester must pass a scheduler hint, using ``group`` as the key and an arbitrary name as the value. Using the :command:`openstack server create` command, use the ``--hint`` flag. For example: .. code-block:: console $ openstack server create --image IMAGE_ID --flavor 1 \ --hint group=foo server-1 This filter should not be enabled at the same time as :ref:`GroupAffinityFilter` or neither filter will work properly.

commit_message:
Add prep upper constraints macro to bifrost jobs

Currently jobs are picking the upper constraints from
the /opt/stack/requirements repo, that is preinstalled and
uses the master branch. We need to properly clone requirements
per branch, and use them.

Change-Id: Ie8cef210b0a4b2fb1060bbcb8359d2d3525f34a0

commit_message:
Move castellan under Oslo governance

The Barbican team would like to move Castellan under Oslo. The hope is
to send a clear signal to everyone that castellan is the preferred
library for their key manager needs and sufficiently abstracts hard
dependency to barbican and attract new folks with alternate implementations.

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/114335.html
http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/barbican/2017/barbican.2017-03-20-20.00.txt

Change-Id: I571dc981a198fcde1a8bdf626ce159b860d452aa

commit_message:
Move vzstorage related code out of RemoteFsClient

Let's keep RemoteFsClient as generic as possible. This patch introduces
VZStorageRemoteFSClient like we do for Scality.

Change-Id: I5891940485c5614d188164d2e0af73486cfa6a90

commit_message:
Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: I11a76066e89b67e4e1934872ffb9daa188513406

commit_message:
Update Fedora images

New release of Fedora Atomic [1].
The new release of Fedora Ironic includes the same
packages.

Main changes:
Kubernetes 1.5.3
etcd 3.1.3
Plus several fixes and version bumps.

Add :Z when mounting certs in the swarm containers to set
selinux labels properly.

[1] http://www.projectatomic.io/blog/2017/03/fedora_atomic_mar28/

(cherry picked from 706371f380f52f96e920f50595b0632bf59b2ef7)

Closes-Bug: #1677664

Change-Id: I2539ae83401db5b34716ebd4bbdfbe288f5c768b

commit_message:
ScaleIO: Fixing support for SIO 1.3x

A few changes necessary to make driver compatible with
ScaleIO version 1.3x
- refactored SIO REST calls to go through common code
- obtain REST API version number dynamically
- allow configuration to override what API version to use
- Make API calls based upon API version
- Add unit tests to validate calls to retrieve version

This commit adds a new configuration option, called:
   sio_server_api_version
   - This can be used to override the value
     retrieved from the ScaleIO server at runtime
   - This is helpful for manual testing, but should
     not be needed in a production environment

DocImpact

Change-Id: I741bc5384fa3a5afcb80f52f4b39b4123e2b8e11
Closes-Bug: #1644904

subject: Avoid router ri.process if initialize() fails
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-08 15:51:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/d4fb916a3d18b5498fd81c068e2ccaf4b96d8713', 'message': 'Avoid router ri.process if initialize() fails

When router_info initialize() fails(with trace) some resources(
like keepalived process) may not be created. While handling this
exception, l3 agent calls _process_updated_router instead of
again calling _process_added_router, which also fails trying to
access resources which are not created.

In this change, agent will have new router_info(i.e
self.router_info[router_id] = ri) only when initialize() success.
When initialize() fails, as router_info is not part of agent,
"_process_router_if_compatible" will again call initialize().
We also cleanup router_info when initialize() fails.

Closes-bug: #1662804
Change-Id: I278ac83de57713c93d6e50846d79034d774c5d47
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-08 16:29:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/5c7550197cdc261656f743f40533c91a455d0610', 'message': 'Avoid router ri.process if initialize() fails

When router_info initialize() fails(with trace) some resources(
like keepalived process) may not be created. While handling this
exception, l3 agent calls _process_updated_router instead of
again calling _process_added_router, which also fails trying to
access resources which are not created.

In this change, agent will have new router_info(i.e
self.router_info[router_id] = ri) only when initialize() success.
When initialize() fails, as router_info is not part of agent,
"_process_router_if_compatible" will again call initialize().
We also cleanup router_info when initialize() fails.

Closes-bug: #1662804
Change-Id: I278ac83de57713c93d6e50846d79034d774c5d47
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-09 14:28:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/77b4ccb44b3dab314661a440c10cca193ccc5a06', 'message': 'Avoid router ri.process if initialize() fails

When router_info initialize() fails(with trace) some resources(
like keepalived process) may not be created. While handling this
exception, l3 agent calls _process_updated_router instead of
again calling _process_added_router, which also fails trying to
access resources which are not created.

In this change, agent will have new router_info(i.e
self.router_info[router_id] = ri) only when initialize() success.
When initialize() fails, as router_info is not part of agent,
"_process_router_if_compatible" will again call initialize().

commit_message:
Avoid router ri.process if initialize() fails

When router_info initialize() fails(with trace) some resources(
like keepalived process) may not be created. While handling this
exception, l3 agent calls _process_updated_router instead of
again calling _process_added_router, which also fails trying to
access resources which are not created.

In this change, agent will have new router_info(i.e
self.router_info[router_id] = ri) only when initialize() succeeds.
When initialize() fails, as router_info is not part of agent,
"_process_router_if_compatible" will again call initialize().
We also cleanup router_info when initialize() fails.

Closes-bug: #1662804
Change-Id: I278ac83de57713c93d6e50846d79034d774c5d47
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/26/431026/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_initialize_fail_retrigger_initialize(self): agent = l3_agent.L3NATAgent(HOSTNAME, self.conf) router = {'id': _uuid(), 'external_gateway_info': {'network_id': 'aaa'}} self.plugin_api.get_routers.return_value = [router] update = router_processing_queue.RouterUpdate( router['id'], router_processing_queue.PRIORITY_SYNC_ROUTERS_TASK, router=router, timestamp=timeutils.utcnow()) agent._queue.add(update) ri = legacy_router.LegacyRouter(agent, router['id'], router, **self.ri_kwargs) ri.delete = mock.Mock() ri.process = mock.Mock() ri.initialize = mock.Mock(side_effect=[RuntimeError(), None]) agent._create_router = mock.Mock(return_value=ri) agent._process_router_update() agent._process_router_update() self.assertTrue(ri.delete.called) self.assertEqual(2, ri.initialize.call_count) self.assertEqual(2, agent._create_router.call_count) self.assertEqual(1, ri.process.call_count) self.assertIn(ri.router_id, agent.router_info)

commit_message:
fix dns implementation

dns is happened to plugin_base and breaks neutron. It should only be
included in ml2 plugin.

Change-Id: I59194ad7d42eb9c175e71df901b94826ea915230

commit_message:
[upstream] Updates to Contribution Process Overview

This patch removes a lot of the extra information so that topics
are not covered in detail more than once. It also condenses
information and reorders some of the slides for a better flow into
the following slide sections.

Change-Id: I5b0026487a68eed881ea4d7cd0bf3545d9560cd1

added_lines: .. notes Each project has its own purpose & culture. Building Your Persona ===================== - Review other's code - Help fix the documentation - Answer other's questions or help direct them to those who can - Attend the meetings - Have a network - Pay attention to who is an expert in what area - Ask questions in the channel or send direct messages .. notes If people know you, your code will get more attention- usually - Create your commit and push upstream for review .. notes We will go into this later on in more detail so hold off on answering detailed questions for now

commit_message:
Neutron manager initialized in TestTrackedResource tests

Neutron manager wasn't initialized during the setUp process
of TestTrackedResource tests. Those unit tests were failing
when executed manually.

Change-Id: I494cb487aa634323f4a0763e83d049ddf3b40d93
Closes-Bug: #1677676

commit_message:
Add support to create UEFI bootable iso

iso-image-create script can create only BIOS bootable iso.
This fix adds support to create UEFI bootable iso for 'ubuntu',
'fedora', 'centos' and 'debian' based systems.

Change-Id: I6f4b77483a801353b30725a3de9c7f32ef93a169
Closes-Bug: 1552090
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent refs/changes/60/289260/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: function distro_name() { ISSUE_FILE="/etc/issue" DISTRO_NAME="" grep -i ubuntu /etc/issue && DISTRO_NAME="ubuntu" grep -i fedora /etc/issue && DISTRO_NAME="fedora" grep -i debian /etc/issue && DISTRO_NAME="debian" v_print "Working on $DISTRO_NAME" } function build_efiboot_img() { if [ $DISTRO_NAME = "fedora" ]; then GRUB_FILE="/boot/efi/EFI/fedora/grubx64.efi" SHIM_FILE="/boot/efi/EFI/fedora/shim.efi" else GRUB_FILE="/usr/lib/grub/x86_64-efi-signed/grubx64.efi.signed" SHIM_FILE="/usr/lib/shim/shim.efi.signed" fi cp $SHIM_FILE $TMP_BUILD_DIR/bootx64.efi cp $GRUB_FILE $TMP_BUILD_DIR/grubx64.efi dd if=/dev/zero of=$TMP_BUILD_DIR/efiboot.img bs=1K count=5760 mkdosfs -F 12 $TMP_BUILD_DIR/efiboot.img # Create a temporary mount point: MOUNTPOINT=$TMP_BUILD_DIR/tmpmount mkdir $MOUNTPOINT sudo mount -o loop $TMP_BUILD_DIR/efiboot.img $MOUNTPOINT sudo mkdir -p $MOUNTPOINT/EFI/BOOT sudo cp $TMP_BUILD_DIR/bootx64.efi $MOUNTPOINT/EFI/BOOT sudo cp $TMP_BUILD_DIR/grubx64.efi $MOUNTPOINT/EFI/BOOT sudo umount $MOUNTPOINT rmdir $MOUNTPOINT cp $TMP_BUILD_DIR/efiboot.img $TMP_IMAGE_DIR/isolinux }# Find and set DISTRO_NAME distro_name if [[ -z "$DISTRO_NAME" || \ "$DISTRO_NAME" != "fedora" && \ "$DISTRO_NAME" != "debian" && \ "$DISTRO_NAME" != "ubuntu" ]]; then err_print "Not a supported linux distribution. Supported distributions are 'ubuntu', 'fedora' and 'debian'" exit 1 fi #fedora: if [ $DISTRO_NAME = "fedora" ]; then EFI_BOOT_DIR="EFI/fedora" EXTRA_KERNEL_PARAMS="usbcore.autosuspend=-1" #debian elif [ $DISTRO_NAME = "debian" ]; then EFI_BOOT_DIR="EFI/debian" EXTRA_KERNEL_PARAMS="" #ubuntu: else EFI_BOOT_DIR="EFI/ubuntu" EXTRA_KERNEL_PARAMS="" fi echo "Creating EFI/$DISTRO_NAME directory" mkdir -p "$TMP_IMAGE_DIR/$EFI_BOOT_DIR" # Generate grub.cfg for default booting echo "Generating grub.cfg" cat > "$TMP_IMAGE_DIR/$EFI_BOOT_DIR/grub.cfg" << END_CONFIG set default="0" set timeout="5" set hidden_timeout_quiet=false menuentry "install" { search --set=root --label INSTALL_IMAGE linuxefi /vmlinuz $EXTRA_KERNEL_PARAMS boot_method=vmedia -- initrdefi /initrd } END_CONFIG build_efiboot_img cd $TMP_IMAGE_DIR && $MKISOFS -r -V "INSTALL_IMAGE" \ -cache-inodes -J -l -b isolinux/isolinux.bin -no-emul-boot \ -boot-load-size 4 -boot-info-table -eltorito-alt-boot \ -e isolinux/efiboot.img -no-emul-boot -o $OUTPUT_FILENAME .

commit_message:
Use HostAddressOpt for opts that accept IP and hostnames

Some configuration options were accepting both IP addresses
and hostnames. Since there was no specific OSLO opt type to
support this, we were using ``StrOpt``. The change [1] that
added support for ``HostAddressOpt`` type was merged in Ocata
and became available for use with oslo version 3.22.

This patch changes the opt type of configuration options to use
this more relevant opt type - HostAddressOpt.

[1] I77bdb64b7e6e56ce761d76696bc4448a9bd325eb

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I8ffea7e1baeecddd20fb12bdc917f8aaa69c6ea2

commit_message:
Use HostAddressOpt for opts that accept IP and hostnames

Some configuration options were accepting both IP addresses and hostnames.
Since there was no specific OSLO opt type to support this, we were using
``StrOpt``. The change [1] that added support for ``HostAddressOpt`` type
was merged in Ocata and became available for use with oslo version 3.22.

This patch changes the opt type of configuration options to use this more
relevant opt type - HostAddressOpt.

[1] I77bdb64b7e6e56ce761d76696bc4448a9bd325eb

Change-Id: If7a62b980ada030e40b3397e621ffd1a9671ab82

commit_message:
Add Consistency Group Support for the Hitachi VSP driver

This patch adds consistency group support for the Hitachi VSP driver.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint hitachi-vsp-add-consistency-groups

Change-Id: I047d5cf460ae2fda69d87c314a5c066a4567d016

commit_message:
Restrain the unmanage snapshot for the VSP drivers

Hitachi VSP storage has the dependency between volumes and snapshots.
The users have to unmanage volumes have the dependency with snapshots
after unmanaging snapshot. If users don't exclude these volumes from
managed targets, the volumes stay inside OpenStack while snapshots
depending on such volumes are outside OpenStack. In Hitachi VSP storage,
operations on these volumes aren't accepted because dependency
relationships remain.
Considering the case where users didn't unmanage volumes which have
dependency with snapshots, It is necessary to restrain unmanage
snapshot for Hitachi VSP drivers. We will consider how to manage and
unmanage snapshot have the dependency from now on.

DocImpact: Document that VSP drivers doesn't support manage/unmanage
snapshots

Change-Id: I1a4e4dca3831b2a390ddefa96392dbc4ef8db98e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/95/421095/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def unmanage_snapshot(self, snapshot): """Prepare the snapshot for removing it from Cinder management.""" utils.output_log(MSG.UNMANAGE_SNAPSHOT_NOT_SUPPORTED, snapshot_id=snapshot['id']) raise NotImplementedError()

subject: Add an option to improve the performance of attach/detach volume
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-16 08:15:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/66fdf92361942446a7f80f339cee67acb6f71591', 'message': 'Add an option to impleve the performance of attach/detach volume

Added a new config option ``vsp_horcm_name_only_discovery`` to improve
the performance of attaching or detaching volumes. Upon request for
attaching or detaching volumes, the driver searches for host groups or
iSCSI targets that are already connected to the host.

If this option is set to True, the driver checks only host groups or
iSCSI targets that are most likely to be connected to the host.
If this option is set to False, the driver checks other host groups or
iSCSI targets as well.
Setting this option to True may improve the performance of attaching or
detaching volumes. The default is False.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I04317506c26db6365ee9f84cc0b58c762255cae6

commit_message:
Add an option to improve the performance of attach/detach volume

Added a new config option ``vsp_horcm_name_only_discovery`` to improve
the performance of attaching or detaching volumes. Upon request for
attaching or detaching volumes, the driver searches for host groups or
iSCSI targets that are already connected to the host.

If this option is set to True, the driver checks only host groups or
iSCSI targets that are most likely to be connected to the host.
If this option is set to False, the driver checks other host groups or
iSCSI targets as well.

Setting this option to True will improve the performance of attaching
or detaching volumes when there are a lot of host groups in Hitachi VSP
storage. Instead of improving the search performance, The users need to
use be careful with the host group name. The default is False.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I04317506c26db6365ee9f84cc0b58c762255cae6

' 'Setting this option to True may improve the performance of ' 'attaching or detaching volumes.'), cfg.ListOpt( 'vsp_horcm_pair_target_ports', help='IDs of the storage ports used to copy volumes by ShadowImage or ' 'Thin Image. To specify multiple ports, connect them by commas ' '(e.g. CL1-A,CL2-A).'), if (not self.conf.vsp_target_ports and not self.conf.vsp_horcm_pair_target_ports): msg = utils.output_log(MSG.INVALID_PARAMETER, param='vsp_target_ports or ' 'vsp_horcm_pair_target_ports') raise exception.VSPError(msg) if self.storage_info['pair_ports']: targets['info'] = {} ports = self._get_pair_ports() for port in ports: targets['info'][port] = True def _get_pair_ports(self): """Return a list of ports used for volume pair management.""" return (self.storage_info['pair_ports'] or self.storage_info['ports'])

commit_message:
Remove log translations

Log messages are no longer being translated. This removes all use of
the _LE, _LI, and _LW translation markers to simplify logging and to
avoid confusion with new contributions.

Change-Id: I504de69b2e64250740ebcab432042a16f966fdbe
Closes-Bug: #1674584

commit_message:
[overcloud-prep-images] Update deprecated openstack command

For Newton releases, the nodes registration and boot configuration are
done through the same command. The 'openstack overcloud node import'
is doing now the following steps:

1- importing baremetal nodes from the instackenv.json files
2- the node status will be set to 'manageable' by default
3- Assigning the deployment kernel and ramdisk to all nodes

Change-Id: I64ccbf01b0812c97c6b4474930f221b2380da5d4
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/18/440518/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {% if release in ['liberty', 'mitaka', 'newton' ] %}{% else %} openstack overcloud node import instackenv.json openstack overcloud node configure --all-manageable {% endif %}

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary setUp function in testcase

In testcase, setUp will be called automatically. This patch used to
remove setUp functions that do nothing. Besides, it will keep code clean.

Change-Id: Iea05647ce355ac047194093ecae602c48414b133

commit_message:
Run cluster check on nodes configured in wsrep_cluster_address.

Attempt to check galera's cluster status fails when galera service
is not running on the same node.

Change-Id: I27fb0841d85cd0dc86e92ac2e21eedf5f8f863ab
Closes-Bug: #1677574
(cherry picked from commit d39c952fd3150d24c9e01c15806181715d0760f8 )
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/67/451467/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: RETVAL=$( pcs resource show galera-master | grep wsrep_cluster_address | grep -q `crm_node -n` ; echo $? ) if [[ $RETVAL -eq 0 && -e /etc/sysconfig/clustercheck ]]; then tstart=$(date +%s) while ! clustercheck; do sleep 5 tnow=$(date +%s) if (( tnow-tstart > galera_sync_timeout )) ; then echo "ERROR galera sync timed out" exit 1 fi done fi
deleted_lines: tstart=$(date +%s) while ! clustercheck; do sleep 5 tnow=$(date +%s) if (( tnow-tstart > galera_sync_timeout )) ; then echo "ERROR galera sync timed out" exit 1 fi done

commit_message:
60 seconds for a cluster check seems too short

When a health policy was created with the value in the
example, it will run check each 60 seconds, it will gererate
many checking events and actions.
And when the node number in cluster is a bit large it always
can't complete cluster check in 60 seconds.
So maybe it's better to set the default example interval to 600 seconds.

Change-Id: I272ab7e3001cbd8e3640ef15d34e12b48442065f

commit_message:
Revise the default max value of cluster check

This patch revises the default max value of cluster check.
Cluster check is a time-consuming action ,it is particular
.So we add a new config option 'check_interval_max' which's
defalut is large than 'periodic_interval_max'.

Change-Id: I06b4ecf7181e436fcb06f27eb8defce48c27a24a

commit_message:
Allow to specify tenant_id in subnetpool-create

Previously tenant_id option was ignored in subnetpool-create.
--tenant-id option is supported in all create commands in neutron CLI
and it is important to keep this consistency for good user experience.

Change-Id: Ifab51d623f8f3519523b284fc04e5b28301b5928
Closes-Bug: #1667279

commit_message:
Wrap README.md lines to 79 chars

Wrap source lines so that lines length does not exceed 79 characters.
This requirement matches PEP8 standards (from Python) and helps with
side-by-side diffs on reviews. [0]

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/contributor-guide/rst-conv/general-guidelines.html

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/loci refs/changes/44/451744/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: OpenStack LOCI is a project designed to quickly build Lightweight OCI compatible images of OpenStack services.Images are built in the Docker Hub automatically on each commit to LOCI as on every commit to the backing service. Using Keystone as an example, if openstack/keystone or openstack/loci-keystone merges a commit then a new image is built to provide a continuously updated set of images based on a number of distributions. Additionally, individual repos may be used to build images for development purposes or as part of a CI/CD workflow. The instructions below can be used for any OpenStack service currently targeted by LOCI. For simplicity, we will continue to use Keystone as an example.It's really easy to build images locally for the distro of your choice. To build an image you only need to run: * If present, rather than using a docker image containing OpenStack requirements a tarball will be used from the defined URL, `WHEELS` This makes it really easy to integrate LOCI images into your development or CI/CD workflow, for example, if you wanted to build an image from [this PS](https://review.openstack.org/#/c/418167/) you could run:The images should contain all the required assets for running the service. But if you wish or need to customize the `openstackloci/keystone` image that's great! We hope to have built the images to make this as easy and flexible as possible. To do this we recommend that you perform any required customisation in a child image using a pattern similar to:

Using Keystone as an example, if openstack/keystone or openstack/loci-keystone merges a commit then a new image is built to provide a continuously updated set of images based on a number of distributions. Additionally, individual repos may be used to build images for development purposes or as part of a CI/CD workflow. The instructions below can be used for any OpenStack service currently targeted by LOCI. For simplicity, we will continue to use Keystone as an example.It's really easy to build images locally for the distro of your choice. To build an image you only need to run: * If present, rather than using a docker image containing OpenStack requirements a tarball will be used from the defined URL, `WHEELS` This makes it really easy to integrate LOCI images into your development or CI/CD workflow, for example, if you wanted to build an image from [this PS](https://review.openstack.org/#/c/418167/) you could run:The images should contain all the required assets for running the service. But if you wish or need to customize the `openstackloci/keystone` image that's great! We hope to have built the images to make this as easy and flexible as possible. To do this we recommend that you perform any required customisation in a child image using a pattern similar to:

commit_message:
Use shorter timeout for update step

The update step should take less time than the create step, and if
we use the full create timeout then we will run past the gate
timeout and get killed with no logs.  Based on the current graphite
metrics, all successful jobs are finishing update in under 45
minutes so that should be safe value.

Change-Id: I0e9761c81b95fdf85c4f57daedb630a6e0cb9db2
Closes-Bug: 1674770
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/78/448778/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(bnemec): Hard-coding this to 45 minutes based on current Graphite metrics OVERCLOUD_UPDATE_TIMEOUT=45 # We need a shorter timeout for the update step. 80 minutes puts us past # the gate timeout in most cases. OVERCLOUD_UPDATE_ARGS=$(echo $OVERCLOUD_UPDATE_ARGS | sed "s/-t $OVERCLOUD_DEPLOY_TIMEOUT/-t $OVERCLOUD_UPDATE_TIMEOUT/")

commit_message:
Xenapi: a new VDI store via streaming

Introduce a new VDI store to upload and download images using streaming
through the Compute node.

Change-Id: I281a5ed87590f864ff4830a9b59e63c188277510
Blueprint: xenapi-image-streaming
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/45/274045/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== XenAPI: VDI store via streaming ========================================== Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/xenapi-image-streaming Introduce a new VDI store to upload and download image via a streaming way on the Compute node. Problem description =================== In the existing XenAPI image upload and download handler, the real downloading and uploading function is finished by the XAPI plugin working in Dom0. There are some problems: 1. Two much reliance on the XAPI plugin running on Dom0 2. XenSever Dom0 now only support python 2.4. So the plugin is wroten with python 2.4. There is no UT for it. 3. the way handling the VHD files is not formal supported. There is no adequate testing. 4. it only support EXT as the local SR's type. But XenServer's default local SR type is LVM. Use Cases ---------- With this solution, the XenServer cloud administrator can configure ''image_download_handler'' and ''image_upload_handler'' to pass data between glance and SR VDI via streaming way on the compute node when download or upload images. Proposed change =============== Create a new VdiStreamStore to handle image download and upload function via streaming on compute node. This new Store can be chosen via nova conf. 1. **Download_image**: 1). Download image stream from glance and pipe the gzipped tarball data stream 2). xtract VHD file from stream and pipe VHD file content 3). Invoke XAPI to create a VDI and use http(s) to import VHD file to VDI. ''http(s)://<host IP>/import_raw_vdi?<reuqired parameters>'' 2. **Upload_image**: 1). Use http(s) request to export VHD stream from SR VDI ''http(s)://<host IP>/export_raw_vdi?<reuqired parameters>'' 2). Create gzipped tarball from the stream on fly and pass the data stream to glance service to create the image. *Note: With this implement, it can't support multiple VHD files in the tarball. As it has to re-parent the vhd files to build the VDI chain if there are multiple VHD files. It has race condition with SR GC. e.g. SR GC will audit VHD files and may delete the imported VHDs before they are re-parenting properly. But we only use VdiStreamStore to upload images, it won't have multiple VHDs in a single tarball. Alternatives ------------ We can resolve the problems in the old implement via the following way. * **Download_image**: Download the compressed tar file temporarily on the local disk; Unpack the compressed tar file and then upload/import the VHD file to XenServer's SR. * **Upload_image**: Download/export the VHD file from XenServer's SR and save it temporarily on the local disk; create the compressed tar file and upload it to Glance service. But it wil introduce new problems: * It will occupy extra disk space on the compute node; it's not acceptable specially when the image is large. * It starts uploading after finishing the first downloading on local disk. It's less efficient by comparing to the proposed change. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- The change is transparent to REST API. Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- Performance Impact ------------------ Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: jianghuaw Other contributors: Work Items ---------- * Need create a new class ''VdiStreamStore'' and implement the functions of ''upload_image'' and ''download_image''. * Add new config option image_download_handler for image handler (image_upload_handler exists already) so that this new Store can be chosen to take effective. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= * Unit tests. * Citrix XenServer CI. Documentation Impact ==================== * Need add the new config option of ''image_download_handler'' and the new VDI store of ''VdiStreamStore'' in the nova configuration document. References ========== History =======

commit_message:
Define resource actions/statuses in a separate class

This is the easiest way to make use of them in multiple unrelated classes.

Change-Id: I49d42921efe4044e7a60ef127b6a69dc0831c238
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/67/435167/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from heat.engine import statusclass Resource(status.ResourceStatus): no_signal_actions = (status.ResourceStatus.SUSPEND, status.ResourceStatus.DELETE)
deleted_lines: class Resource(object): ACTIONS = ( INIT, CREATE, DELETE, UPDATE, ROLLBACK, SUSPEND, RESUME, ADOPT, SNAPSHOT, CHECK, ) = ( 'INIT', 'CREATE', 'DELETE', 'UPDATE', 'ROLLBACK', 'SUSPEND', 'RESUME', 'ADOPT', 'SNAPSHOT', 'CHECK', ) STATUSES = (IN_PROGRESS, FAILED, COMPLETE ) = ('IN_PROGRESS', 'FAILED', 'COMPLETE') no_signal_actions = (SUSPEND, DELETE)

commit_message:
Using assertIsNone() instead of assertEqual(None)

TrivilalFix

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines:
[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more
specific assertions. As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over
assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(..., None)

Change-Id: Iafa51b52d3f290272e452f6505e3c22eb52fff2e

commit_message:
Retry the cirros image download

As the cirros image is downloaded from an external
source, download failures may happen. This task
should be retried.

Change-Id: I1a3b71d794745bf70a82afce15d72fe9bb3d2119
(cherry picked from commit 9d2bfb09d1ebbc9102329b0d42de33aa321e57b1)

commit_message:
Create official murano install guide.

Currently, murano does not have an official murano install guide
located at [0], which affects murano maturity at [1].

This patch creates the official murano install guide following
the tutorial here: [2].

Also adds tox entry for generating the install guide.

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/project-install-guide/ocata/ubuntu-services.html
[1] https://www.openstack.org/software/releases/ocata/components/murano
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/contributor-guide/project-install-guide.html

Change-Id: I98052b646f3b1e97915aa7382dd2e60eaa4a6137

added_lines: # Class to execute freezer-manage db sync# to the freezer-manage db sync command. These will be inserted # in the command line between 'freezer-manage' and 'db sync'. include ::freezer::deps include ::freezer::params exec { 'freezer-db-sync': command => "freezer-manage ${extra_params} db sync", path => [ '/usr/local/bin/', '/usr/bin', ], subscribe => [ Anchor['freezer::install::end'], Anchor['freezer::config::end'], Anchor['freezer::dbsync::begin'] ], notify => Anchor['freezer::dbsync::end'], }
deleted_lines: # Class to execute freezer-manage db_sync# to the freezer-dbsync command. exec { 'freezer-db-sync': command => "freezer-manage db_sync ${extra_params}", path => [ '/bin', '/usr/bin', ], subscribe => [Package['freezer'], Freezer_config['database/connection']], } Exec['freezer-manage db_sync'] ~> Service<| title == 'freezer' |>

commit_message:
Replace yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Avoid dangerous file parsing and object serialization libraries.
yaml.load is the obvious function to use but it is dangerous[1]
Because yaml.load return Python object may be dangerous if you
receive a YAML document from an untrusted source such as the
Internet. The function yaml.safe_load limits this ability to
simple Python objects like integers or lists.

In addition, Bandit flags yaml.load() as security risk so replace
all occurrences with yaml.safe_load(). Thus I replace yaml.load()
with yaml.safe_load()

[1]https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: I6f0750834070a467eaa7fd0633285a44bfceb5b2
Closes-Bug: #1634265

commit_message:
Replace yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Avoid dangerous file parsing and object serialization libraries.
yaml.load is the obvious function to use but it is dangerous[1]
Because yaml.load return Python object may be dangerous if you
receive a YAML document from an untrusted source such as the
Internet. The function yaml.safe_load limits this ability to
simple Python objects like integers or lists.

In addition, Bandit flags yaml.load() as security risk so replace
all occurrences with yaml.safe_load(). Thus I replace yaml.load()
with yaml.safe_load()

[1]https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: Id153471a4a0b2b597d920c46f93a3318b79e9e84
Closes-Bug: #1634265

commit_message:
Indicating the location tests directory in oslo_debug_helper

According to [1], we can passing a "-t" argument to
oslo_debug_helper to indicate the directory where tests
are located. This will solves ImportError exception.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslotest/features.html

Change-Id: I03da7cacff8cb7f23f886ca36a410cac101c93b5

commit_message:
LLC Noisy neighbor strategy

a new strategy that migrates a VM consuming large amount
of last level cache (LLC) while being co-located with other VMs
on a host.

Change-Id: Ief8d4b41231583a30ecdb122106f60f891f7650b
Partiallly-Implements: blueprint noisy-neighbor-strategy

commit_message:
Revert "Skip DHCP agent query in provisioning block setup"

This reverts commit 4ba0e75254b087c232be18c007d50045606b20b5.

This broke the fullstack job, which doesn't setup DHCP agents
so we get stuck waiting for ports to become active.

Change-Id: I28ac1362c3be7a459cfff5dad2b5251e4edd13fa

commit_message:
Add V3 support for Keystone scenarios

The KeystoneBasic scenario now translates the calls into a V3 client as
required, depending on the api_versions context and which version of
the client was constructed.

When creating a keystone client, you can now specify which API version
you want.  Any of (2, "v2", "2", "v2.0", 3, "v3", "3") is valid.  If no
version is specified, the existing behaviour continues: the keystone API
will select what it believes to be the most appropriate.

The client version can be specified with the api_versions context
config in tasks.

Change-Id: I01e71ea07d3523ed849fed3d55fb6890e98542d8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/25/277225/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from six.moves.urllib import parse@configure("keystone", supported_versions=(2, "v2", "2", "v2.0", 3, "v3", "3")) def _create_keystone_client(self, args, version=None): v2_versions = (2, "v2", "2", "v2.0") if "v2.0" not in args["auth_url"] and version not in v2_versions: return client.Client(version=version, **args) def _override_url(self, version): """If version is specified, remove any version from the auth_url. The keystone Client code requires that auth_url be the root url if a version override is used. """ url = parse.urlparse(self.credential.auth_url) # NOTE(bigjools): This assumes that non-versioned URLs have no # path component at all. parts = (url.scheme, url.netloc, "/", url.params, url.query, url.fragment) return parse.urlunparse(parts) def create_client(self, version=None): if version is not None: kw["auth_url"] = self._override_url(version) client = self._create_keystone_client(kw, version=version)
deleted_lines: @configure("keystone") def _create_keystone_client(self, args): if "v2.0" not in args["auth_url"]: return client.Client(**args) def create_client(self): client = self._create_keystone_client(kw)

commit_message:
LOG.exception for mech dict extend failure

We generate a new exception here instead of re-raising
so we need to use LOG.exception to make debugging easier.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Iccb2c8576729062ab0d881c867d1e44811ecf931

commit_message:
Follow OVSCookieBridge refactoring in neutron

The refactoring made in I55835a34d8fba7a139dce93f99cbff54584d695c
requires some adjustements in n8g-sfc unit tests, and also
allow simplifying the code a bit.

For this change, it ended up being simpler to not check in each
something which was in fact done at sfc_driver.initialize() time.
These checks are moved to test_init_agent_empty_flowrules, and removed
from other tests.

Change-Id: I5a73cbb0cd52a0fbd467a7e982ad264f057c0d16
Depends-On: Ica421831763eb2f5d25fc068287305b402227b53

As commit 5de6b7eb dropped MIN_LIBVIRT_UEFI_VERSION, it is
no longer necessary to path has_min_version for checking if
uefi is supported. We drop test_has_uefi_support_with_invalid_versiontestcase

commit_message:
tests: fix uefi testcases

As commit 5de6b7eb dropped MIN_LIBVIRT_UEFI_VERSION, it is
no longer necessary to path has_min_version for checking if
uefi is supported. We drop test_has_uefi_support_with_invalid_versiontestcase
as now it does nothing and simply false fails.
Other test cases are fixed as the previous way for setting host
architecture via capabilities didn't take any effect. We should
use for this purpose _stub_host_capabilities_cpu_arch.

Change-Id: I2dfc103dc9bc46de3e65fc03a7abdd2eee10b822
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/09/449109/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self._stub_host_capabilities_cpu_arch(fields.Architecture.ALPHA) self._stub_host_capabilities_cpu_arch(fields.Architecture.X86_64)
deleted_lines: def test_has_uefi_support_with_invalid_version(self): drvr = libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver(fake.FakeVirtAPI(), True) with mock.patch.object(drvr._host, 'has_min_version', return_value=False): self.assertFalse(drvr._has_uefi_support()) caps = vconfig.LibvirtConfigCaps() caps.host = vconfig.LibvirtConfigCapsHost() caps.host.cpu = vconfig.LibvirtConfigCPU() caps.host.cpu.arch = "alpha" caps = vconfig.LibvirtConfigCaps() caps.host = vconfig.LibvirtConfigCapsHost() caps.host.cpu = vconfig.LibvirtConfigCPU() caps.host.cpu.arch = fields.Architecture.X86_64

commit_message:
Add server security groups to shade

We need a way to add and remove security groups to a server in shade.
This will let us modify them from ansible.

Change-Id: I5602e44720485e20491cf4930605362312274b20
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/shade refs/changes/83/451183/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _get_server_security_groups(self, server, security_groups): if not self._has_secgroups(): raise OpenStackCloudUnavailableFeature( "Unavailable feature: security groups" ) if not isinstance(server, dict): server = self.get_server(server) if server is None: self.log.debug('Server %s not found', server) return None, None if not isinstance(security_groups, (list, tuple)): security_groups = [security_groups] sec_group_objs = [] for sg in security_groups: if not isinstance(sg, dict): sg = self.get_security_group(sg) if sg is None: self.log.debug('Security group %s not found for adding', sg) return None, None sec_group_objs.append(sg) return server, sec_group_objs def add_server_security_groups(self, server, security_groups): """Add a security group to a server. Add an existing security group to an existing server. If the security group is already present on the server this will continue unaffected. :returns: True if security groups added, False if not :raises: ``OpenStackCloudException``, on operation error. """ server, security_groups = self._get_server_security_groups( server, security_groups) if not (server and security_groups): return False for sg in security_groups: pass self._compute_client.post( '/servers/%s/action' % server.id, json={'addSecurityGroup': {'name': sg.name}}) return True def remove_server_security_groups(self, server, security_groups): """Remove a security group from a server Remove an existing security group from an existing server. If the security group is not present on the server this will continue unaffected. :returns: True if security groups removed, False if not :raises: ``OpenStackCloudException``, on operation error. """ server, security_groups = self._get_server_security_groups( server, security_groups) if not (server and security_groups): return False for sg in security_groups: try: self._compute_client.post( '/servers/%s/action' % server.id, json={'removeSecurityGroup': {'name': sg.name}}) except OpenStackCloudURINotFound as e: # NOTE(jamielennox): Is this ok? If we remove something that # isn't present should we just conclude job done or is that an # error? Nova returns ok if you try to add a group twice. self.log.debug( "The security group %s was not present on server %s so " "no action was performed", sg.name, server.name) return True

commit_message:
Updated from global requirements

This is a manual sync of our requirements from g-r.  I believe the
bot is not proposing updates because we had an entry in
requirements.txt that was not in g-r, so the update script was
failing.  Once this merges we should get automated updates again.

commit_message:
Add mapping documentation between legacy Neutron CLI and Octavia

Document serves two purposes.
Purpose 1 to help end users figure out which commands are equivalent
to the neutron-lbaas commands.
Purpose 2 is to keep track of the commands that need to be implemented.
Each command that is built will need to update the csv

Change-Id: I3dfedb3313c7a822937ffaece9b122e89bc65670
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-octaviaclient refs/changes/05/451905/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Mapping Guide ============= The following is an incomplete mapping between legacy Neutron CLIs and the Octavia plugin into OSC. Think of it as a magic decoder ring if you were using the legacy CLIs and want to transition to OpenStack CLI. Command options are only shown when necessary. ``LBaaS v2 CLI`` ---------------- .. csv-table:: :header: "Neutron CLI", "OSC Equivalent", "Description" :widths: 25, 25, 50 :file: data/lbaas.csv

commit_message:
Propose spec for dependency validations move

Proposing a spec to move dependency validations to entry creation time.

Change-Id: If3d242d3091814da795b489f253d930d32d901a4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl refs/changes/41/443541/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================ Dependency Validations on Create ================================ https://blueprints.launchpad.net/networking-odl/+spec/dep-validations-on-create Right now V2 driver entry dependency validations happen when a journal entry is picked for processing. This spec proposes that this be moved to entry creation time, in order to have a clear understanding of the entry dependencies and conserve journal resources. Problem Description =================== Dependency validations are necessary in the V2 driver because each operation gets recorded in a journal entry and sent to ODL asynchronously. Thus, a consecutive operation might be sent to ODL before the first one finishes, while relying on the first operation. For example, when a subnet gets created it references a network, but if the network was created right before the subnet was then the subnet create shouldn't be sent over until the network create was sent. Currently these checks are performed each time an entry is selected for processing - if the entry passes the dependency checks then it gets processed and if the dependency check fails (i.e. finds a previous unhandled entry that needs to execute before this one) then the entry gets sent back to the queue. Generally this is not optimal for several reasons: * No clear indication of relations between the entries. * The logic is hidden in the code and there's no good way to know why an entry fails a dependency check. * Difficult to debug in case of problems. * Difficult to spot phenomenon such as a cyclic dependency. * Wasted CPU effort. * An entry can be checked multiple times for dependencies. * Lots of redundant DB queries to determine dependencies each time. Proposed Change =============== The proposed solution is to move the dependency calculation to entry creation time. When a journal entry is created the dependency management system will calculate the depndencies on other entries (Similrly to how it does now) and if there are journal entries the new entry should depend on, their IDs will be inserted into a link table. Thus, when the journal looks for an entry to pick up it will only look for entries that no other entry depends on. When a journal entry is done processing (either successfully or reahces failed state), the dependency links will be removed from the dependency table so that dependent rows can be processed. The proposed table:: +------------------------+ | odl_journal_dependency | +------------------------+ | parent_id | | dependent_id | +------------------------+ The table columns will be foreign keys to the seqnum column in the journal table. The constraints will be defined as "ON DELETE CASCADE" so that when a journal entry is removed any possible rows will be removed as well. The dependency management mechanism will locate parent entries for the given entry and will populate the table so that the parent entry's seqnum will be set as the parent_id, and the dependent entry id will be set as dependent_id. When the journal picks up an entry for processing it will condition it on not having any rows with the parent_id in the dependency table. This will ensure that dependent rows get handled after the parent rows have finished processing. Open Questions ============== Q: Should entries in "failed" state block other entries? A: Currently "failed" rows are not considered as blocking for dependency validations, but we might want to change this as it makes little sense to process a dependent entry that failed processing.

commit_message:
FWaaS OSC plugin: Use python logging instead of oslo.log

CLI implementation including OSC and neutorn CLI does not consume
oslo.log and use python logging directly. At now oslo.log is not
included in requirements.txt of both OSC and neutronclient and
CLI does not use features provided by oslo.log.
Let's use python logging.

Change-Id: I81e943fb87567f0e01635888bebf875ea42a4d02
Closes-Bug: #1676295

commit_message:
Change noauth strategy for plugin loading

Don't do it.

os-client-config's plugin loading has been causing this pain for a long
time, removing the KSC hack-around in o-c-c unmasked this again.  So when
auth is not reuired, just don't let o-c-c do any plugin loading at all.

Ever.

Change-Id: Ie68c82f7b073012685f0513b615ab1bf00bc0c3a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/osc-lib refs/changes/52/450452/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: kwargs = {} if not cmd.auth_required: # Build fake token creds to keep ksa and o-c-c hushed kwargs['auth_type'] = 'token_endpoint' kwargs['auth'] = {} kwargs['auth']['token'] = 'x' kwargs['auth']['url'] = 'x' validate=True, **kwargs

commit_message:
bagpipe ml2: don't wait for DHCP provisioning block to clear

Adapt our unit test like the l2pop unit test are adapted
in I8111469ad4b0d88580bff7a77492ad95af8e9377 .

Needed or else ports never go ACTIVE.

commit_message:
Add skeleton to python-octaviaclient

Add the basic skeleton to python-octaviaclient.
References taken from other openstack client modules.

Change-Id: I2cc292b4b7853a15a909aa1e6c650979e061c8ad
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-octaviaclient refs/changes/31/448331/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may not # use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain a copy # of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. """Utilities and helper functions.""" import argparse import functools import hashlib import logging import os from oslo_utils import encodeutils from oslo_utils import importutils import six from octaviaclient._i18n import _ from octaviaclient import exceptions SENSITIVE_HEADERS = ('X-Auth-Token',) def env(*vars, **kwargs): """Returns the first environment variable set. If none are non-empty, defaults to '' or keyword arg default. """ for v in vars: value = os.environ.get(v) if value: return value return kwargs.get('default', '') def convert_to_uppercase(string): return string.upper() def convert_to_lowercase(string): return string.lower() def get_client_class(api_name, version, version_map): """Returns the client class for the requested API version. :param api_name: the name of the API, e.g. 'compute', 'image', etc :param version: the requested API version :param version_map: a dict of client classes keyed by version :rtype: a client class for the requested API version """ try: client_path = version_map[str(version)] except (KeyError, ValueError): msg = _("Invalid %(api_name)s client version '%(version)s'. must be " "one of: %(map_keys)s") msg = msg % {'api_name': api_name, 'version': version, 'map_keys': ', '.join(version_map.keys())} raise exceptions.UnsupportedVersion(msg) return importutils.import_class(client_path) def get_item_properties(item, fields, mixed_case_fields=(), formatters=None): """Return a tuple containing the item properties. :param item: a single item resource (e.g. Server, Tenant, etc) :param fields: tuple of strings with the desired field names :param mixed_case_fields: tuple of field names to preserve case :param formatters: dictionary mapping field names to callables to format the values """ if formatters is None: formatters = {} row = [] for field in fields: if field in formatters: row.append(formatters[field](item)) else: if field in mixed_case_fields: field_name = field.replace(' ', '_') else: field_name = field.lower().replace(' ', '_') if not hasattr(item, field_name) and isinstance(item, dict): data = item[field_name] else: data = getattr(item, field_name, '') if data is None: data = '' row.append(data) return tuple(row) def str2bool(strbool): if strbool is None: return None return strbool.lower() == 'true' def str2dict(strdict, required_keys=None, optional_keys=None): """Convert key1=value1,key2=value2,... string into dictionary. :param strdict: string in the form of key1=value1,key2=value2 :param required_keys: list of required keys. All keys in this list must be specified. Otherwise ArgumentTypeError will be raised. If this parameter is unspecified, no required key check will be done. :param optional_keys: list of optional keys. This parameter is used for valid key check. When at least one of required_keys and optional_keys, a key must be a member of either of required_keys or optional_keys. Otherwise, ArgumentTypeError will be raised. When both required_keys and optional_keys are unspecified, no valid key check will be done. """ result = {} if strdict: for kv in strdict.split(','): key, sep, value = kv.partition('=') if not sep: msg = _("invalid key-value '%s', expected format: key=value") raise argparse.ArgumentTypeError(msg % kv) result[key] = value valid_keys = set(required_keys or []) | set(optional_keys or []) if valid_keys: invalid_keys = [k for k in result if k not in valid_keys] if invalid_keys: msg = _("Invalid key(s) '%(invalid_keys)s' specified. " "Valid key(s): '%(valid_keys)s'.") raise argparse.ArgumentTypeError( msg % {'invalid_keys': ', '.join(sorted(invalid_keys)), 'valid_keys': ', '.join(sorted(valid_keys))}) if required_keys: not_found_keys = [k for k in required_keys if k not in result] if not_found_keys: msg = _("Required key(s) '%s' not specified.") raise argparse.ArgumentTypeError(msg % ', '.join(not_found_keys)) return result def str2dict_type(optional_keys=None, required_keys=None): return functools.partial(str2dict, optional_keys=optional_keys, required_keys=required_keys) def http_log_req(_logger, args, kwargs): if not _logger.isEnabledFor(logging.DEBUG): return string_parts = ['curl -i'] for element in args: if element in ('GET', 'POST', 'DELETE', 'PUT'): string_parts.append(' -X %s' % element) else: string_parts.append(' %s' % element) for (key, value) in six.iteritems(kwargs['headers']): if key in SENSITIVE_HEADERS: v = value.encode('utf-8') h = hashlib.sha1(v) d = h.hexdigest() value = "{SHA1}%s" % d header = ' -H "%s: %s"' % (key, value) string_parts.append(header) if 'body' in kwargs and kwargs['body']: string_parts.append(" -d '%s'" % (kwargs['body'])) req = encodeutils.safe_encode("".join(string_parts)) _logger.debug("REQ: %s", req) def http_log_resp(_logger, resp, body): if not _logger.isEnabledFor(logging.DEBUG): return _logger.debug("RESP: %(code)s %(headers)s %(body)s", {'code': resp.status_code, 'headers': resp.headers, 'body': body}) def _safe_encode_without_obj(data): if isinstance(data, six.string_types): return encodeutils.safe_encode(data) return data def safe_encode_list(data): return list(map(_safe_encode_without_obj, data)) def safe_encode_dict(data): def _encode_item(item): k, v = item if isinstance(v, list): return (k, safe_encode_list(v)) elif isinstance(v, dict): return (k, safe_encode_dict(v)) return (k, _safe_encode_without_obj(v)) return dict(list(map(_encode_item, data.items()))) def add_boolean_argument(parser, name, **kwargs): for keyword in ('metavar', 'choices'): kwargs.pop(keyword, None) default = kwargs.pop('default', argparse.SUPPRESS) parser.add_argument( name, metavar='{True,False}', choices=['True', 'true', 'False', 'false'], default=default, **kwargs)

commit_message:
api-ref: Fix wrong HTTP response codes

* POST /servers

  The 413 response code has not been expected
  since I470b53af45ff47c1dec98d09d7a426a29ca1efc6.
  So remove 413.

* POST /server/{server_id}/action

  In 'Rebuild' action, the 413 response code has not been expected
  since I470b53af45ff47c1dec98d09d7a426a29ca1efc6.
  So remove 413.

  In 'Rescue' action, the normal response code is actually 200
  instead of 202.
  So fix it.

Change-Id: I6e91d3ac751777f48ab084395a66cb3f83bfcca2
Implements: blueprint api-ref-in-rst-pike
Closes-Bug: #1677452

commit_message:
Fix for quickstart image building

In 57443434af78565cb7850886383f04b5e3ab4a08 we introduced a check
for overcloud_as_undercloud to the convert-image role in order to
make it generic enough to handle converting a baseOS image. This
had the unintended consequence of breaking image building where
we do not set this variable.

Instead, we can just check if the overcloud-full image exists, and
only convert it in that case.

Change-Id: Ica9f55b970db12d2fd98ae6a38a0ee99b171ae1d

commit_message:
Add python35 non-voting job networking-arista

Starting running tests for Python35 for networking-arista. Patches are
proposed to meet this goal, but want to keep the job non-voting until
final py35 compatibility patch merges.

Change-Id: I84e33d72385decfacb74f97cfaa4b38dcfdb0dba

commit_message:
Remove verbose option

The variable ``verbose`` has been removed. Deployers should rely on the
``debug`` var to enable higher levels of memcached logging.

Change-Id: I8100d649eeba6c6ec93fa19b350662bcd14e1899

commit_message:
Adds anti affinity hint and az configuration option

This adds the anti-affinity and availability zone configuration
options and recommends anti-affinity in the config documentation.

Change-Id: Ie4a196eba868b03b52bf98312c6a38b68369ad85

commit_message:
Remove classic multinode jobs from cistatus

There are almost no results for these jobs on the status page at
this point, so there's no reason to include them by default.

Change-Id: I63ef153e03bf59133fcffb1b01fb4512ba3bb227

commit_message:
Added Galera SSL support

MySQL SSL connections allowed. Self-signed SSL bundle
created and placed to the deployment host, or user-provided
SSL bundle (CA, cert and the key) is used.

Change-Id: Ibac61d45cea67123fe61a6de4f906b4bd1949a34
Partial-Bug: #1667789
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-galera_server refs/changes/97/425997/30 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- # Copyright 2014, Rackspace US, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. - name: Create ssl directory file: path: "{{ item.path }}" state: "directory" owner: "{{ item.owner|default('root') }}" group: "{{ item.group|default('root') }}" mode: "{{ item.mode|default('0755') }}" recurse: "{{ item.recurse|default('false') }}" with_items: - { path: "/etc/mysql/ssl", owner: "mysql", group: "mysql", mode: "0750" } tags: - galera-ssl - name: Copy CA cert and key copy: src: "{{ item.src }}" dest: "{{ item.dest }}" mode: "{{ item.mode|default('0640') }}" with_items: - { src: "{{ galera_server_ssl_ca_cert }}", dest: "/etc/mysql/ssl/galera-ca.crt" } - { src: "{{ galera_server_ssl_cert }}", dest: "/etc/mysql/ssl/galera.crt" } - { src: "{{ galera_server_ssl_key }}", dest: "/etc/mysql/ssl/galera.key", mode: "0600" } notify: - Restart mysql tags: - galera-ssl

commit_message:
Tuned should be configured properly

Currently tuned uses the wrong profile on compute nodes. This patch will
allow users to update their tuned profile.

Fixes bug 1667524

Change-Id: Ic67aca7f5338ea4bb2d3843201e122c72d97056e

commit_message:
Disable ec2 collector for deployed-server

In the deployed-server metadata that configures os-collect-config, the
ec2 collector should not be enabled. ec2 metadata is not typically
available when using the deployed-server resource.

Closes-Bug: #1669842
Change-Id: I33e062b70fdf298908656a8ed3e62ac7cae16a37

commit_message:
Add gnocchi to events dispatchers

Lets publish events to panko and gnocchi as we support both.

Change-Id: I2d765d0d1578fd21725b99f06bda9bcb0964e173
(cherry picked from commit 77af3b44644cb4d0e9e9edec379dde77bec621eb)

commit_message:
Diagnose common problems with keystone deployments

keystone-manage doctor is a tool designed to validate the state of a
production deployment, and provide opinionated recommendations to
operators about it's configuration (such as non-fatal interactions
between options) and state (including service catalog, etc).

Change-Id: I2514d0b3773f4b4475b9705be96c5479722d15b9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_keystone refs/changes/23/449723/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Diagnose common problems with keystone deployments command: "{{ keystone_bin }}/keystone-manage doctor"

commit_message:
run_tests.sh: Do not remove the ".tox" directory

Users of run_tests.sh may execute it in a tox environment so we should
not remove the '.tox' directory midway through as that will break
the running tests.

Change-Id: I8f82363a700d94e8d44951599323bbcc07cf7fec
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests refs/changes/48/451848/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Create $::rdo_mirror_host

Currently, openstack-infra has create an proxy cache of
trunk.rdoproject.org. This is a short term solutions until we add RDO
to our AFS mirrors. Update repo.pp to start using it.

We also use the direct hash from delorean.repo, to avoid potential
issue where packages chages on remote node after we start downloading
things.

Change-Id: Id1819cf0dc49a89256a971ce9d8420622db901e8
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

Deprecate auth_plugin option

Option "auth_plugin" is deprecated, use option "auth_type" instead.

commit_message:
Fix deprecated eqlx parameters

The eqlx_use_chap, eqlx_chap_login and  eqlx_chap_password were
previously deprecated and are scheduled to be removed in Pike. This
change updates these parameters to use the replacement params.

See I295d8388ba17dd60e83995e7c82f64f02a3c4258 for more details.

Change-Id: I0f229ed2e7bb65d9da81c5caa69dbe1a4aded814

commit_message:
Allow cert validation for hatop download to be disabled

When using a TLS proxy, the certificate validation may fail.
This patch allows the validation to be optionally disabled.

Change-Id: I4bc854486a5ef694c4bc8a29546586a068f55af7
(cherry picked from commit 4e9dd2ab5ab866a301c74efe71be2361d112a6ab)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-haproxy_server refs/changes/19/451819/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Validate Certificates when downloading hatop. May be set to "no" when proxy server # is intercepting the certificates. haproxy_hatop_download_validate_certs: yes

commit_message:
mysql: fix the packages mapping on RHEL7 (mariadb)

RHEL7 configuration is the same as CentOS7 (or the other way around).
uses mariadb like CentOS7

Closes-Bug: #1675119
Change-Id: I7ea7a6f327f69a7271b605733ba95ef296bebef7
(cherry picked from commit 04982540767c9d6fe54cc57e1d4ca3ef418be636)

commit_message:
Adds unique constraint on name and tenant_id

Update the schema for VIM, VNFD, VNF, NS and NSD tables
to constraint the name per tenant as unique.

Change-Id: I463fe02ebd4b0f720260bda1c3da4cdebc6ec238
Closes-bug: #1667641

You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # """unique constraint on name and id Revision ID: c256228ed37c Revises: 8f7145914cb0 Create Date: 2017-03-01 12:28:58.467900 """ # revision identifiers, used by Alembic. revision = 'c256228ed37c' down_revision = 'ef14f8026327' from alembic import op def _add_unique_constraint(table): op.create_unique_constraint( constraint_name='%s_unique_name_tenant_id' % table, table_name=table, columns=['name', 'tenant_id']) def upgrade(active_plugins=None, options=None): for table in ['vnf', 'vnfd', 'vims']: _add_unique_constraint(table)

commit_message:
Add Microversion support to Horizon

This patch adds microversion support to Horizon, as well as
documentation, service references, tests and an example.

Implements: blueprint microversion-support
Change-Id: Ic5aa559dbc13aa84d8e4a14b68f26f5d84183fa9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/19/411919/22 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import novaclient as client from novaclient import api_versionsfrom openstack_dashboard.api import microversions@memoized def get_microversion(feature): return (microversions.get_microversion_for_feature( 'nova', feature, api_versions.APIVersion, client.API_MIN_VERSION, client.API_MAX_VERSION)) @memoized def is_feature_available(feature): return bool(get_microversion(feature)) def novaclient(request_auth_params, microversion=None): kwargs = { "project_id": project_id, "auth_url": auth_url, "insecure": INSECURE, "cacert": CACERT, "http_log_debug": settings.DEBUG } if microversion: kwargs['api_version'] = microversion **kwargs)
deleted_lines: VERSIONS.load_supported_version(2.9, {"client": nova_client, "version": 2.9})def novaclient(request_auth_params): project_id=project_id, auth_url=auth_url, insecure=INSECURE, cacert=CACERT, http_log_debug=settings.DEBUG)

commit_message:
Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: Ic28c0a6e8db6d6360c00ec834e474826cc3ada27

commit_message:
Add "Save and Close" button to configuration modal dialog

Depending on your preferred workflow, you might want the dialog to close once
you've saved your changes.  To support both scenarios, this commit introduces a
new button in the same form which simply reads "Save and Close".  This way, the
user can choose what they'd like to happen once their changes are saved.

Change-Id: I2f22b51b19b170ba12527d66f6b8c0e0b2883190
Closes-Bug: #1674789
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ui refs/changes/81/451981/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import { Link, browserHistory } from 'react-router'; }, saveAndClose: { id: 'EnvironmentConfiguration.saveAndClose', defaultMessage: 'Save And Close' closeOnSubmit: false, if (this.state.closeOnSubmit) { this.setState({ closeOnSubmit: false }); browserHistory.push(this.props.parentPath); } } onSubmitAndClose() { this.setState({ closeOnSubmit: true }, this.refs.environmentConfigurationForm.submit); <button type="button" disabled={!this.state.canSubmit} onClick={this.onSubmitAndClose.bind(this)} className="btn btn-default"> <FormattedMessage {...messages.saveAndClose} /> </button>

subject: Ensure the components are isolated from the system
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-29 03:20:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_neutron/commit/e5e8318d561deebe131cace1bb827a8e89550d2e', 'message': "Ensure the components are isolated from the system

This creates a specific slice which all OpenStack services will operate
from. By creating an independent slice these components will be governed
away from the system slice allowing us to better optimise resource
consumption.

See the following for more information on slices:

* https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/systemd.slice.html

See for following for more information on resource controls:

* https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/systemd.resource-control.html

Tools like ``systemd-cgtop`` and ``systemd-cgls`` will now give us
insight into specific processes, process groups, and resouce consumption
in ways that we've not had access to before. To enable some of this reporting
the accounting options have been added to the [Service] section of the unit
file.

Change-Id: I6078d6cf19da27afc22b5f699165acea0139ddc1
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Ensure the components are isolated from the system

This creates a specific slice which all OpenStack services will operate
from. By creating an independent slice these components will be governed
away from the system slice allowing us to better optimise resource
consumption.

See the following for more information on slices:

* https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/systemd.slice.html

See for following for more information on resource controls:

* https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/systemd.resource-control.html

Tools like ``systemd-cgtop`` and ``systemd-cgls`` will now give us
insight into specific processes, process groups, and resouce consumption
in ways that we've not had access to before. To enable some of this reporting
the accounting options have been added to the [Service] section of the unit
file.

Change-Id: I6078d6cf19da27afc22b5f699165acea0139ddc1
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary setUp function in testcase

In testcase, setUp will be called automatically. This patch used to
remove setUp functions that do nothing. Besides, it will keep code clean.

commit_message:
Skip PortNotFound when unbinding port

There might be cases when user deleted port before doing vif_detach.
With this patch info message will be shown in the logs for such cases.

Change-Id: Ic3c5073130a4839f27692db1862100bdd7dfca1e

commit_message:
Add docker install for ubuntu-xenial

As of now we only have one gate, ubuntu-xenial. Add docker setup

Change-Id: I497c876c79fb3894b7a47ef0f639f1f651adb20b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/loci refs/changes/73/451973/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: function setup_docker { echo 'deb http://apt.dockerproject.org/repo ubuntu-xenial main' | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/docker.list sudo apt-key adv --keyserver hkp://p80.pool.sks-keyservers.net:80 --recv-keys 58118E89F3A912897C070ADBF76221572C52609D sudo apt-get update sudo apt-get install --no-install-recommends -y docker-engine sudo systemctl stop docker sudo mount -t tmpfs tmpfs /var/lib/docker sudo tee /etc/systemd/system/docker.service << EOF [Service] ExecStart= ExecStart=/usr/bin/dockerd --userns-remap default --storage-driver overlay2 EOF sudo systemctl daemon-reload sudo systemctl start docker } setup_docker

commit_message:
Extend Quota API to report usage statistics

This patch proposes a new extension for quota API.
This adds following endpoint: GET /v2.0/quotas/{tenant_id}/detail
It reports detailed quotas for a specific tenant such as
reserved, limit and used for each resource.

Change-Id: I3cfe95f429d5aef771c906f7fcd7175d1d44523a
Co-Authored-By: Sean M. Collins <sean@coreitpro.com>
Co-Authored-By: Prince Boateng<prince.a.owusu.boateng@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Aradhana Singh <aradhana1.singh@intel.com>
Related-bug: #1599488
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-specs refs/changes/47/348947/21 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =========================================== Extend Quota API to report usage statistics =========================================== Problem Description =================== The current Neutron Quota API just reports the resources and their limits for a tenant. Other project Quota APIs include usage details for a specific tenant. Proposed Change =============== The "Quota Sets" API extension that is provided by Nova[2] and Cinder[3] should be adopted by Neutron, in order to provide better cross-project APIs when it comes to resource quotas and more features. Data Model Impact ----------------- A Quota Set resource is introduced, which contains a set of resources, with their corresponding reservation, and limits, as well as the in_use count for each tenant REST API Impact --------------- Currently, the Quota API provides the following REST API endpoint for quota details for a specific tenant/project GET /v2.0/quotas/{tenant_id} :: { "quota": { "subnet": 10, "network": 10, "floatingip": 50, "subnetpool": -1, "security_group_rule": 100, "security_group": 10, "router": 10, "rbac_policy": -1, "port": 50 } } In the new Quota Seta API extension, a more featureful API would be introduced that provides both the *reserved*, *limit*, and *in_use* counts. :: { "quota_set": { "subnet": { "reserved": 0, "limit": 10, "in_use": 0 }, "network": { "reserved": 0, "limit": 10, "in_use": 0 }, "floatingip": { "reserved": 0, "limit": 50, "in_use": 0 }, "subnetpool": { "reserved": 0, "limit": -1, "in_use": 0 }, "security_group_rule": { "reserved": 0, "limit": 100, "in_use": 0 }, "security_group": { "reserved": 0, "limit": 10, "in_use": 0 }, "router": { "reserved": 0, "limit": 10, "in_use": 0 }, "rbac_policy": { "reserved": 0, "limit": -1, "in_use": 0 }, "port": { "reserved": 0, "limit": 50, "in_use": 0 } } } Command Line Client Impact -------------------------- A new option will be added to the neutronclient, for example: $ neutron quota-show {ARGS} --details Security Impact --------------- None Notifications Impact -------------------- None Other End User Impact --------------------- Changes in Horizon Horizon would use that new API. Instead of counting all of the neutron resources [4], Horizon would just use one Quota API call. Performance Impact ------------------ None IPv6 Impact ----------- None Other Deployer Impact --------------------- None Developer Impact ---------------- None Community Impact ---------------- None Alternatives ------------ None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Work Items ---------- 1. Extend Quota DB driver 2. Extend current API 3. Add related tests 4. OSC support 5. Update neutron client to support the new API Dependencies ============ None. Testing ======= Tempest Tests ------------- Unknown Functional Tests ---------------- Unknown API Tests --------- - Quota v2 API resource Documentation Impact ==================== Yes User Documentation ------------------ None Developer Documentation ----------------------- Yes References ========== https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1599488 [2]: http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-compute-v2.1.html#listDetailQuotas [3]: http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-blockstorage-v2.html#showQuota [4]: https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/10.0.0.0b1/openstack_dashboard/usage/quotas.py#L313-L336

commit_message:
Add "Save and Close" button to configuration modal dialog

Depending on your preferred workflow, you might want the dialog to close once
you've saved your changes.  To support both scenarios, this commit introduces a
new button in the same form which simply reads "Save and Close".  This way, the
user can choose what they'd like to happen once their changes are saved.

Change-Id: I2f22b51b19b170ba12527d66f6b8c0e0b2883190
Closes-Bug: #1674789

commit_message:
Use AFS mirrors for centos hammer and jewel repos

When running CI jobs we need to use available AFS mirrors to avoid
network connectivity problems.
Close-Bug: #1676421
Change-Id: I7abdbe2806f0d8eb66edc40ade6f67d75d875c33

added_lines: repo_cmd_before: | sudo yum install -y yum-plugin-priorities; sudo yum clean all; sudo rm -rf /etc/yum.repos.d/delorean*; sudo rm -rf /etc/yum.repos.d/*.rpmsave; if [[ -e /etc/nodepool/provider ]]; then source /etc/nodepool/provider; export NODEPOOL_MIRROR_HOST=$(echo "mirror.$NODEPOOL_REGION.$NODEPOOL_CLOUD.openstack.org" | tr '[:upper:]' '[:lower:]'); fi sudo yum-config-manager --save --setopt centos-ceph-jewel.gpgcheck=0; if [[ -n "${NODEPOOL_MIRROR_HOST:-''}" ]]; then sudo yum remove -y centos-release-ceph-jewel; sudo yum-config-manager --add-repo "${NODEPOOL_MIRROR_HOST}/centos/7/storage/x86_64/ceph-jewel/"; fi

commit_message:
Allow cert validation for hatop download to be disabled

When using a TLS proxy, the certificate validation may fail.
This patch allows the validation to be optionally disabled.

Change-Id: I4bc854486a5ef694c4bc8a29546586a068f55af7
(cherry picked from commit 4e9dd2ab5ab866a301c74efe71be2361d112a6ab)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-haproxy_server refs/changes/20/451820/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix error status check when create backup

Now when creating backup from snapshot, the volume's status is
still checked.

This patch is a quick fix.

Change-Id: I3a477ed622f076de9451741d198ac1d62c8d5b40
Related-Bug: #1670541
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/11/451211/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if snapshot_id: log_message = ('Create backup started, backup: %(backup_id)s ' 'volume: %(volume_id)s snapshot: %(snapshot_id)s.' % {'backup_id': backup.id, 'volume_id': volume_id, 'snapshot_id': snapshot_id}) else: log_message = ('Create backup started, backup: %(backup_id)s ' 'volume: %(volume_id)s.' % {'backup_id': backup.id, 'volume_id': volume_id}) LOG.info(log_message) expected_status = "backing-up" if snapshot_id: else: actual_status = volume['status'] if actual_status != expected_status: err = _('Create backup aborted, expected volume status ' '%(expected_status)s but got %(actual_status)s.') % { 'expected_status': expected_status, 'actual_status': actual_status, } self._update_backup_error(backup, err) raise exception.InvalidVolume(reason=err)
deleted_lines: LOG.info('Create backup started, backup: %(backup_id)s ' 'volume: %(volume_id)s.', {'backup_id': backup.id, 'volume_id': volume_id}) expected_status = 'available' if snapshot_id else "backing-up" actual_status = volume['status'] if actual_status != expected_status: err = _('Create backup aborted, expected volume status ' '%(expected_status)s but got %(actual_status)s.') % { 'expected_status': expected_status, 'actual_status': actual_status, } self._update_backup_error(backup, err) raise exception.InvalidVolume(reason=err) if snapshot_id: expected_status = fields.SnapshotStatus.BACKING_UP

commit_message:
fix tox -e cover

by excluding tests/haht/test_congress_haht.py which
cannot run in parallel.

Closes-Bug: 1669166

Change-Id: I277f14865d471d4e0a776d1d9496163a1e34732e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/congress refs/changes/69/449369/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: commands = python setup.py testr --coverage --testr-args='^(?!congress\.tests\.haht\.test_congress_haht.*){posargs}'
