commit_message:
Look for diskimage-builder not dib-utils when building amps

Also ignore E402 and W503 pep8 issues

Change-Id: I7937d0a21c7a748cd682511bd429de8cf0ffe498
(cherry picked from commit cf9a8c8f779a3542681a4b3ea3274681cec6f682)

commit_message:
virt: update overhead to take into account vCPUs

This commit updates the method responsible to compute the overhead to
take into account vCPUs.

implements blueprint libvirt-emulator-threads-policy

Change-Id: I42c9de1f2c548f5ffc5d6bd1598aee10c70ca568
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/24/385024/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LOG.debug("CPU overhead for %(flavor)d vCPUs instance; %(overhead)d " "vCPU(s)", {'flavor': instance.flavor.vcpus, 'overhead': overhead.get('vcpus', 0)}) LOG.debug("CPU overhead for %(flavor)d vCPUs instance; %(overhead)d " "vCPU(s)", {'flavor': instance.flavor.vcpus, 'overhead': overhead.get('vcpus', 0)}) vcpus_usage = usage.get('vcpus', 0) vcpus_usage += overhead.get('vcpus', 0) self.compute_node.vcpus_used += sign * vcpus_usage

subject: Remove XML description from media-types
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-22 18:02:04.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/source/v2/samples/version-v2-show-response.json', 'api-ref/source/v3/samples/version-v3-show-response.json', 'api-ref/source/v3/samples/version-v2-show-response.json', 'api-ref/source/v1/samples/version-show-response.json', 'api-ref/source/v2/samples/version-show-response.json', 'api-ref/source/v3/samples/version-show-response.json'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/c8bfb4b8ebac93ad7882be7695b052ecb0120f2c', 'message': "Remove XML description from media-types

Since the commit If98db25f1f4032725444c3959acb9aad8f869802 XML
support has been removed from Cinder API. And the version API
doesn't return XML entity on media-types.
Then this patch removes the entity from sample files.

Change-Id: I782d5cf7a152647254d9a36edcc7352000139dc3
"}]
commit_message:
Remove XML description from media-types

Since the commit If98db25f1f4032725444c3959acb9aad8f869802 XML
support has been removed from Cinder API. And the version API
doesn't return XML entity on media-types.
Then this patch removes the entity from sample files.

Change-Id: I782d5cf7a152647254d9a36edcc7352000139dc3

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary setUp function in testcase

In testcase, setUp will be called automatically. This patch used to
remove setUp functions that do nothing. Besides, it will keep code clean.

Change-Id: Ib9586a4c8fef171f0e83508d588b45097fa1c687

subject: Disable RA and IPv6 forwarding on backup HA routers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-07 14:23:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/f8d1c76266e569714c2f4a4f17f57f5a4b449bd3', 'message': "Disable RA and IPv6 forwarding on backup HA routers

Neutron does not disable ipv6 forwarding for HA routers and it's
enabled by default in all router namespaces. For ipv6, this means
that it will automatically join the following groups:

* link-local all-routers multicast group (ff02::2)
* interface-local all routers multicast group (ff01::2)
* site-local all routers multicast group (ff05::2))

As a side effect it will answer to multicast listener queries, thus
causing external switch to learn its MAC address and disrupting traffic
to the master instance.

This patch will enable ipv6 forwarding on the gateway interface only
for master instances and disable it otherwise to fix the issue.

Also, the accept_ra procfs entry was enabled under certain
circumstances but it wasn't disabled otherwise. This patch, will
disable RA on the gateway interface for non master instances.

Closes-Bug: #1667756

Change-Id: I9bc890b43f750cad68fc67f4c79f1426c3506863

commit_message:
Disable RA and IPv6 forwarding on backup HA routers

Neutron does not disable ipv6 forwarding for HA routers and it's
enabled by default in all router namespaces. For ipv6, this means
that it will automatically join the following groups:

* link-local all-routers multicast group (ff02::2)
* interface-local all routers multicast group (ff01::2)
* site-local all routers multicast group (ff05::2))

As a side effect it will answer to multicast listener queries, thus
causing external switch to learn its MAC address and disrupting traffic
to the master instance.

This patch will enable ipv6 forwarding on the gateway interface only
for master instances and disable it otherwise to fix the issue.

Also, the accept_ra procfs entry was enabled under certain
circumstances but it wasn't disabled otherwise. This patch, will
disable RA on the gateway interface for non master instances.

Closes-Bug: #1667756

Change-Id: I9bc890b43f750cad68fc67f4c79f1426c3506863

Otherwise, disable them. if not ex_gw_port_id: return interface_name = ri.get_external_device_name(ex_gw_port_id) if ri.router.get('distributed', False): namespace = ri.ha_namespace else: namespace = ri.ns_name enable = state == 'master' ri._configure_ra_on_gw(ri.ex_gw_port, namespace, interface_name, enable) ri._configure_ipv6_forwarding_on_gw(namespace, interface_name, enable)
deleted_lines: self._configure_ipv6_ra_on_ext_gw_port_if_necessary(ri, state) def _configure_ipv6_ra_on_ext_gw_port_if_necessary(self, ri, state): # Router Advts from upstream router for default route. if state == 'master' and ex_gw_port_id: interface_name = ri.get_external_device_name(ex_gw_port_id) if ri.router.get('distributed', False): namespace = ri.ha_namespace else: namespace = ri.ns_name ri._enable_ra_on_gw(ri.ex_gw_port, namespace, interface_name)

commit_message:
Move service provider to DocumentedRuleDefault

A new policy class was introduce that requires
additional parameters when defining policy objects.

This patch switches our service provider policy object to
the policy.DocumentedRuleDefault and fills the
required policy parameters as needed.


Change-Id: Ia604313d85d607995ffad4f5bb8aff83e7ed7c84
Partially-Implements: bp policy-docs

commit_message:
Skip flaky test_create_router_set_gateway_with_fixed_ip

test_create_router_set_gateway_with_fixed_ip starts by allocating an IP
from the public_network, then it deletes that IP (which releases the
IP back to the pool), then it tries to create a router with a fixed
external IP set to the IP value it got earlier.

But in the mean time, another test could have claimed the very same IP
because there's a fraction of time when the IP is again available. In
that case, the create router call fails with

Body: {"NeutronError": {"message": "IP address 172.24.5.2 already allocated
in subnet 41f6fb6a-f10d-4a9a-9b9b-235bbbde0891", "type":
"IpAddressAlreadyAllocated", "detail": ""}}

Change-Id: I9761b094351709f97e5b1524935d070796c64273
Related-Bug: #1676207

commit_message:
[arch-design] Reorganize front page and overview chapter

1. Restructure index pages for the Ops Guide and Arch Guide
2. Rename and reorganize the overview chapter
3. Migrate security requirements, legal requirements, deployment, and
capacity planning and scaling content to the Ops Guide

Change-Id: Ic22d58f48ba11b59839d8fe39046281d26fa033c
Implements: blueprint arch-design-pike
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/84/450084/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: This guide is a work in progress. Contributions are welcome.The Architecture Design Guide provides information on planning and designing an OpenStack cloud. It explains core concepts, requirements that impact cloud architecture design, design criteria of key components and services in an OpenStack cloud, and five common cloud use cases. Before reading this book, we recommend: * Prior knowledge of cloud architecture and principles. * Linux and virtualization experience. * A basic understanding of networking principles and protocols. For information about deploying and operating OpenStack, see the `Installation Tutorials and Guides<https://docs.openstack.org/project-install-guide/ocata/>`_, deployment guides, `Deployment Guides <https://docs.openstack.org/project-deploy-guide/ocata/`_, and the `OpenStack Operations Guide <https://docs.openstack.org/ops-guide/>`_. arch-requirements.rst use-cases.rst
deleted_lines: Parts of this guide is a work in progress. Contributions are welcome.This guide provides information on planning and designing an OpenStack cloud. It describes common use cases, high availability, and considerations when changing capacity and scaling your cloud environment. A breakdown of the major OpenStack components is also described in relation to cloud architecture design. overview.rst use-cases.rst high-availability.rst capacity-planning-scaling.rst Appendix ~~~~~~~~ .. toctree:: :maxdepth: 1 Glossary ~~~~~~~~ .. toctree:: :maxdepth: 1

commit_message:
Move project policies to DocumentedRuleDefault

A new policy class was introduced that requires
additional parameters when defining policy objects.

This patch switches our project policy object to
the policy.DocumentedRuleDefault and fills the
required policy parameters as needed.

Change-Id: Id71099b83920100fa141b588af65dbfd925b8483
Partially-Implements: bp policy-docs

subject: Support required positional arguments correctly
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-28 18:52:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.config/commit/f8c184ccec6a2dd39d3da7807d41cf991fc24618', 'message': "Support required positional arguments correctly

Right now, if you define an option in oslo.config as both: required=True
and positional=True, then oslo.config mistakenly passes nargs='?' to
argparse, resulting in an optional positional argument:

  usage: script.py [file]

Instead of allowing argparse to require it:

  usage: script.py file

This patch simply skips the definition of nargs (effectively setting it
back to it's default value of None) when required=True, which is
argparse's assumption for positional arguments (that they're required).

Change-Id: Icb52484e73a25c836aa332a0f927dbc6bbf5ffb6
Partial-Bug: 1676989
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-28 20:16:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.config/commit/cf49659086e9918098a52a0a319192301a0e8bbd', 'message': "Support required positional arguments correctly

commit_message:
Support required positional arguments correctly

Right now, if you define an option in oslo.config as both: required=True
and positional=True, then oslo.config mistakenly passes nargs='?' to
argparse, resulting in an optional positional argument:

  usage: script.py [file]

Instead of allowing argparse to require it:

  usage: script.py file

This patch simply skips the definition of nargs (effectively setting it
back to it's default value of None) when required=True, which is
argparse's assumption for positional arguments (that they're required).

Change-Id: Icb52484e73a25c836aa332a0f927dbc6bbf5ffb6
Partial-Bug: 1676989

commit_message:
Add spec for sahara-scenario API

bp api-for-scenario-tests

Change-Id: I0814ba5dfeea204fccdf058cad5ba2cd0b542584
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-specs refs/changes/54/443554/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: =================================================================== Add an API to sahara-scenario for integration to another frameworks =================================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/sahara-tests/+spec/api-for-scenario-tests Sahara scenario is the main tool for testing Sahara and we can provide API for using this framework in another tools/framworks/tests. Problem description =================== When you perform testing of Sahara from another framework, you can't re-use created scenarios and need to create similar code in another framework with new scenarios for Sahara. I think, that we can implement simple API for running Sahara scenarios from default templates. It will be useful, for example in frameworks for destructive testing or something else. Proposed change =============== Refactor current `runner.py` module, pull out code in `sahara_tests/scenario/utils.py` for re-using it in API methods. I propose move code with: - creation of tmp files, - working with *.mako, - running tests, - merging/generation of scenario files. In `runner.py` leave only calls of this methods, for more convenient usage. The next step is adding of directory `api` in `sahara_tests/scenario` with files for implementing API. I think, we need to add file `api.py` with methods for external usage: - def run_scenario(plugin, version, release=None) and `base.py` with auxiliary methods: - searching of scenario files - preparing of files for running In future we can separate one scenario by steps: - create node group template - create cluster template - create cluster - preform EDP Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Deployer impact --------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Sahara-image-elements impact ---------------------------- None Sahara-dashboard / Horizon impact --------------------------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: esikachev Work Items ---------- - move methods from `runner.py` - add the ability to run tests via API - add the job for testing API Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= We can create separate job on Sahara-ci with custom script for checking API calls and correct performing of actions. Documentation Impact ==================== The API implementation should be mentioned in Sahara-tests docs. References ========== None

commit_message:
Fix Trove URIs

The openstack service uris protocol variables were not being used
to set the Trove specific uris. This resulted in 'http' always being
used for the public, admin, and internal uris even when 'https' was
intended.

Change-Id: I8a1fd0a851b932f8ee853866155e968824ed5fb8
(cherry picked from commit 277c454e80bfc21834356969a2d3d48b5ca969f5)

Fix typo in cloud number

If we are on rh1 cloud, let's source rh1.env file.

Change-Id: Ife88b4d0b920dae6e2830748c91dbccfd55a17eb

commit_message:
Fix ratio to percent on failure rate graphs

This commit fixes the ratio values to percent on failure rate graphs. We
already use percents in many graphs and users are familiar with percents
rather than ratio.

Change-Id: I056b62b215230b4666401eabace42cac7e68201d
Closes-Bug: #1674066

commit_message:
Change default period of all graphs to 1 week

This commit changes default period of all graphs to 1 week except
grouped-runs which is already set as 2 weeks. We already changed it in
the home page[1] and it seems good. So let's make it the others.

[1] Ia8cdf52d191453c9bab59669550c0d7dc8faa6e2

Change-Id: Idaec6617032c48c64aa7e860bc95a7556e43f1c9

commit_message:
Update tox build settings

Remove heatclient and magnumclient from install-tips

We do not consume them anymore, so do not need to install them as part
of our tips testing.

Install from pip using upper-constraints. To ensure we work with
OpenStack releases.

Change-Id: I98f39d2e2a591eb84a1ebcd033eb51e1758f1f39

commit_message:
Remove policy file from source and refactor tests

This patch removes the policy file now that policy in code has merged
and we now have all the default policy from policy.json in code. In
addition it refactors a couple of tests to use the in code policy
instead of the policy.json file when testing.

Depends-On: Ib1d9a51a78e2a84a3d7294dc8782605a681fa9e8
Change-Id: I23136627cb095015352b8eb09c31b2b2f1ce315f
Implements: blueprint policy-in-code

commit_message:
Support multiple messages from create_raid_configuration

This updates the workflow wrapper to use the multiple message interface.

Change-Id: I5aea1f924c91675301e35f007634ae01fa6d39de
Partial-Bug: #1646887

commit_message:
Add send_signal_to_resource/mark_resource_unhealthy to heat client.

Currently, the 2 client methods:

  1) send_signal_to_resource
  2) mark_resource_unhealthy

are not in the orchestration client in Tempest [0] but are valid
heat endpoints [1].

This patch adds both of these client methods to the orchestration
client and creates the base orchestration client test class (as
it currently doesn't exist), with tests for both client methods.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/tree/master/tempest/tests/services
[1] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/orchestration/v1/

Change-Id: I99e53b0bbb91489e695c70c5ab7775c557fb5e93

commit_message:
Remove log translations

Log messages are no longer being translated. This removes all use of
the _LE, _LI, and _LW translation markers to simplify logging and to
avoid confusion with new contributions.

See:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2016-November/002574.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html

Change-Id: Idd2a06dd76d0ad081915bc1e9d83224c9ac47bd4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-sfc refs/changes/94/447894/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix broken command prompt

Interactive editing of the command line was broken due to the usage of
$PROMPT_COMMAND. The cursor would often be placed at the wrong location
when editing history due to prompt length confusion. We already had the
OS_CLOUDNAME variable for this purpose, and I took the prompt setting
logic from what we previously used in tripleo-incubator:

http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tripleo-incubator/tree/cloudprompt

Change-Id: I85d6a2be597477ff74ba72ffa4c4aefc42c0df3c
Partial-Bug: #1673459
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/99/450899/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: CLOUDPROMPT = """ # Add OS_CLOUDNAME to PS1 if [ -z "${CLOUDPROMPT_ENABLED:-}" ]; then export PS1=\${OS_CLOUDNAME:+"(\$OS_CLOUDNAME)"}\ $PS1 export CLOUDPROMPT_ENABLED=1 fi """ overcloudrc = overcloudrc + CLOUDPROMPT overcloudrc_v3 = overcloudrc_v3 + CLOUDPROMPT

commit_message:
Docs: bump tempest microversion caps after branching

These should remain uncapped on master, so we should update the caps
after branching, and only on the stable branch.

Change-Id: Ia35f4f6250accee201a3ea2e2ba49772f672142a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/02/451802/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * set appropriate defaults for TEMPEST_BAREMETAL_MIN_MICROVERSION and TEMPEST_BAREMETAL_MAX_MICROVERSION in devstack/lib/ironic to make sure that unsupported API tempest tests are skipped on stable branches.
deleted_lines: * Set appropriate defaults for TEMPEST_BAREMETAL_MIN_MICROVERSION and TEMPEST_BAREMETAL_MAX_MICROVERSION in devstack/lib/ironic to make sure that unsupported API tempest tests are skipped on stable branches.

subject: Fix Trove URIs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-30 14:23:00.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/public-uri-proto-a1f05edd1a594f7f.yaml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_trove/commit/277c454e80bfc21834356969a2d3d48b5ca969f5', 'message': "Fix Trove URIs

The openstack service uris protocol variables were not being used
to set the Trove specific uris. This resulted in 'http' always being
used for the public, admin, and internal uris even when 'https' was
intended.

Change-Id: I8a1fd0a851b932f8ee853866155e968824ed5fb8
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Trove URIs

The openstack service uris protocol variables were not being used
to set the Trove specific uris. This resulted in 'http' always being
used for the public, admin, and internal uris even when 'https' was
intended.

Change-Id: I8a1fd0a851b932f8ee853866155e968824ed5fb8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_trove refs/changes/43/451843/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: trove_service_proto: http trove_service_publicuri_proto: "{{ openstack_service_publicuri_proto | default(trove_service_proto) }}" trove_service_internaluri_proto: "{{ openstack_service_internaluri_proto | default(trove_service_proto) }}" trove_service_adminuri_proto: "{{ openstack_service_adminuri_proto | default(trove_service_proto) }}"

commit_message:
Disable mistral v2 tempest tests

RDO has been hitting https://bugs.launchpad.net/mistral/+bug/1671505
in RDO-CI around 50% of the runs for ocata jobs recently. I'm proposing to
disable it until we get it fixed.

Change-Id: I8a5e9ade62111db00d5074db03ecdf732156debc

commit_message:
Remove unused CG code

There are CG related code in api, scheduler, and manager that are
no longer invoked in Pike. This is because we will force users to
migrate all existing CGs and CGsnapshots to the new generic volume
groups tables when they upgrade to Pike. CG CLI and API are still
supported in Pike. They will be re-directed to create/modify
entries in generic volume groups tables instead.

Database and versioned object related code are still kept for now
because there are still drivers referencing them.

Change-Id: Ieba87c6725f07564fd5a69674602eb3ca6200db3

commit_message:
libvirt: return a CPU overhead if isolate emulator threads requested

Makes libvirt to determine whether or not a vCPU overhead should be
taken into account when returning resources usage

implements blueprint libvirt-emulator-threads-policy

Change-Id: Id8af966d624be499af3f9b5008582df5d796f90d

commit_message:
Remove deprecated IOUtils class

This was used when logging instance serial console output, consuming
named pipes. Nova stopped using it in Newton.
(I58c328391a80ee8b81f66b2e09a1bfa4b26e584c)

As its usage is limited and 2 cycles have passed since we stopped
using it, we're now removing it.

Change-Id: I989b34afd7971730b4fdc9feb38d4e1ada6ed5d5

    motd::content: "Hello World!/n"

    rsyslog::client::remote_servers:
      - host: logs.foo.example.com
        port: 55514
        protocol: udp
      - host: logs.bar.example.com
        port: 555
        pattern: '*.log'
        protocol: tcp
        format: RFC3164fmt

commit_message:
Install additional Puppet modules as pre-deploy task.

These OpenStack HEAT templates can be used with TripleO to
install additional puppet modules during the pre-deploy
stage.

There a three templates:
- extra-puppet-modules-from-forge.yaml
    Use a Forge repository, such as https://forgeapi.puppetlabs.com
    to dowload, and install/upgrade modules.
- extra-puppet-modules-from-git.yaml
    Clone one or more git repositories, build module packages
    and install them.
- extra-puppet-modules-from-satellite.yaml
    Uses a Satellite 6 puppet repository as source, downloads and
    installs/upgrades modules.

Once the modules are installed they can be included as part of the
TripleO deployment by adding them to '*_classes' in ExtraConfig.

Example:

parameter_defaults:
  #
  # All nodes, ExtraConfig
  #
  ExtraConfig:
    #
    # Include modules
    #
    compute_classes:
      - ::motd
      - ::rsyslog::client
    controller_classes:
      - ::motd
      - ::rsyslog::client

    #
    # Override class parameter values
    #
    motd::content: "Hello World!/n"
    rsyslog::client::spool_size: 2g
    rsyslog::client::remote_servers:
      - host: logs.foo.example.com
        port: 55514
        protocol: udp
      - host: logs.bar.example.com
        port: 555
        pattern: '*.log'
        protocol: tcp
        format: RFC3164fmt

Closes-Bug: #1653663
Change-Id: Id15b732ae63396b55a27d4e53999b13e58cbbcfa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/13/406613/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/python2 import os import sys import yaml from subprocess import PIPE, Popen from time import strftime import pycurl from cStringIO import StringIO MODULE_PATH = '/etc/puppet/modules' MODULE_STAGE_DIR = '/var/tmp/modules_stage' + strftime("-%d%m%Y-%H%M") INPUT_ENV_VAR = 'EXTRA_PUPPET_MODULES_SAT' PULP_URL = '/pulp/puppet/' MODULE_CACHE_DIR = '/var/lib/puppet/puppet-module/cache' METADATA_FILE = 'modules.json' if not os.path.exists(MODULE_PATH): os.makedirs(MODULE_PATH) if not os.path.exists(MODULE_STAGE_DIR): os.makedirs(MODULE_STAGE_DIR) ### The first time puppet module install run it complain # about missing /var/lib/puppet/puppet-module/cache directory. # Making sure directory exist... # Possibly related to: # https://tickets.puppetlabs.com/browse/PUP-1639 if not os.path.exists(MODULE_CACHE_DIR): os.makedirs(MODULE_CACHE_DIR) #Create loader for the Ruby object in puppet yaml ############################################################################## def construct_ruby_object(loader, suffix, node): return loader.construct_yaml_map(node) def construct_ruby_sym(loader, node): return loader.construct_yaml_str(node) yaml.add_multi_constructor(u'!ruby/object:', construct_ruby_object) yaml.add_constructor(u'!ruby/sym', construct_ruby_sym) ############################################################################## # Funcitons ############################################################################## def get_installed_modules(modulepath): installed_modules = [] data = yaml.load(Popen([ 'puppet', 'module', 'list', '--modulepath', modulepath, '--render-as', 'yaml' ], stdout=PIPE).communicate()[0]) for module in data['modules_by_path'][modulepath]: installed_modules.append(module.get('name')) return installed_modules def puppet_module_uninstall(module, module_path): ps = Popen([ 'puppet', 'module', 'uninstall', '--force', '--modulepath', MODULE_PATH, module ]) ps.communicate() return None def puppet_module_install(modulePackage, modulePath): ps = Popen([ 'puppet', 'module', 'install', '--ignore-dependencies', '--target-dir', modulePath, modulePackage ]) ps.communicate() return None def download_file(filePath, fileName, url): file = '/'.join([ filePath, fileName ]) f = open(file, 'wb') curl = pycurl.Curl() curl.setopt(pycurl.URL, url) curl.setopt(pycurl.WRITEDATA, f) curl.perform() curl.close() f.close() return file def get_metadata(url, metadataFile): buff = StringIO() curl = pycurl.Curl() curl.setopt(pycurl.URL, '/'.join([ url, metadataFile])) curl.setopt(pycurl.WRITEFUNCTION, buff.write) curl.perform() curl.close() metadata = yaml.safe_load(buff.getvalue()) return metadata ############################################################################## # MAIN ############################################################################## data = yaml.safe_load(os.environ.get(INPUT_ENV_VAR)) installed_modules = get_installed_modules(MODULE_PATH) base_url = ( '://'.join([ data.get('protocol'), data.get('server') ]) + PULP_URL + '-'.join([ data.get('organization'), data.get('environment'), data.get('content_view') ]) ) metadata = get_metadata(base_url, METADATA_FILE) for module in data.get('modules'): author = module.split('-')[0] name = module.split('-')[1] # Get version of module, need it to build module_filename version = False for entry in metadata: if entry.get('author') == author and entry.get('name') == name: version = entry.get('version') break if not version: print "Module not in repository" sys.exit(1) # Download module module_path = '/'.join([ 'system', 'releases', author[0], author]) module_filename = '-'.join([ author, name, version]) + '.tar.gz' module_url = '/'.join([ base_url, module_path, module_filename ]) module_pkg = download_file(MODULE_STAGE_DIR, module_filename, module_url) if name in installed_modules: puppet_module_uninstall(module, MODULE_PATH) puppet_module_install(module_pkg, MODULE_PATH) quit() ##############################################################################

subject: Modify policy parser to combine custom and default policy files.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-23 22:49:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/patrole/commit/052300b9f07e81a595df50ea352242da66445ce5', 'message': '[WIP] Policy merge

Change-Id: Idb6b8a99170fd32097940d5b23182f5e43956548
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-24 03:13:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/patrole/commit/737ab405ca4ac3dd3c95d8801e610b8525ad904d', 'message': 'Modify policy parser to combine custom and default policy files.

Currently, the rbac policy parser file tries to:
  1) Read the custom policy file if it exists
  2) Otherwise check if the default policy file exists in code

The problem with this approach is:
  - What if the custom policy file does not specify ALL policy
    actions?
  - What if even the default policy file does not specify ALL
    policy actions?

This patch partially fixes this issue by 1) using all the
default policy actions defined in code, if they exit and 2)
overwriting any default policy actions with the custom
policy actions provided by the user in a custom policy file.

Still, this patch does not solve the following issue:
  - What if the custom policy file only contains SOME policy
    actions AND no default policy code exists?

One possible solution to this approach is to either:
  1) Download the default policy file
  2) Check nova/etc/policy.json (inside the nova repo)
     for example

Change-Id: Idb6b8a99170fd32097940d5b23182f5e43956548

  2) Otherwise check if the default policy file exists in code

The problem with this approach is:

  - This also holds true for default policy files which may not define
    all the policy actions enforced by the service explicitly.

This patch partially fixes this issue by 1) using all the
default policy actions defined in code, if they exist and 2)
overwriting any default policy actions with the custom
policy actions provided by the user in a custom policy file.

The end result is that the Patrole framework uses as many policy actions
as possible for reference, while using as many custom-defined policy
actions as possible. This patch, therefore, makes it more feasible to
throw an exception if a policy action is invalid.

commit_message:
Modify policy parser to combine custom and default policy files.

Currently, the rbac policy parser file tries to:
  1) Read the custom policy file if it exists
  2) Otherwise check if the default policy file exists in code

The problem with this approach is:
  - What if the custom policy file does not specify all policy actions?
    This is problematic when it comes to validating the policy action:
    is it defined or not?
  - This also holds true for default policy files which may not define
    all the policy actions enforced by the service explicitly.

This patch partially fixes this issue by 1) using all the
default policy actions defined in code, if they exist and 2)
overwriting any default policy actions with the custom
policy actions provided by the user in a custom policy file.

The end result is that the Patrole framework uses as many policy actions
as possible for reference, while using as many custom-defined policy
actions as possible. This patch, therefore, makes it more feasible to
throw an exception if a policy action is invalid.

Change-Id: Idb6b8a99170fd32097940d5b23182f5e43956548
Depends-On: I7feb522b2ea5f56e48982169c7ebbb2ec2ef2cb3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/patrole refs/changes/48/449348/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import jsonimport stevedore from oslo_config import cfgCONF = cfg.CONF # Use default path in /etc/<service_name/policy.json if no path # is provided. self.path = path or os.path.join('/etc', service, 'policy.json') file_policy_data = mgr_policy_data = policy_data = {} # Check whether policy file exists. Otherwise use oslo_policy to fetch # the rules for provided service. try: file_policy_data = json.loads(file_policy_data) except ValueError: pass else: mgr = stevedore.named.NamedExtensionManager( 'oslo.policy.policies', names=[service], on_load_failure_callback=None, invoke_on_load=True) policy_generator = {policy.name: policy.obj for policy in mgr} if policy_generator and service in policy_generator: for rule in policy_generator[service]: policy_data[rule.name] = rule.check.__str__() if file_policy_data and mgr_policy_data: for action, rule in mgr_policy_data.items(): policy_data[action] = rule for action, rule in file_policy_data.items(): policy_data[action] = rule elif file_policy_data: policy_data = file_policy_data elif mgr_policy_data: policy_data = mgr_policy_data else: raise rbac_exceptions.RbacParsingException( 'Policy file for service: {0}, {1} not found.' .format(service, self.path)) try: policy_data = json.dumps(policy_data) except ValueError: raise rbac_exceptions.RbacParsingException( 'Policy file for service: {0}, {1} not found.' .format(service, self.path))

commit_message:
Ignores "Not found" jobs when stopping jobs

While stopping an element's jobs (e.g.: VM), we are iterating
through its jobs and get the jobs that are still pending. These jobs
can finish while looping over them, resulting in "x_wmi Not found"
exceptions.

Skips job objects that are no longer found.

NOTE(claudiub): The WMI exceptions were added to os_win.exceptions in
Ocata in order to use them directly, instead of conditionally importing
the wmi module. Which is there are a few differences between this
cherry-pick and the patch on master.

Conflicts:
	os_win/utils/jobutils.py

Change-Id: I73476d4d9651e6b5792a94a228796292b922e843
Closes-Bug: #1668260
(cherry picked from commit b7b05b6720287dac1c9ab28d215b342c366f20e5)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-win refs/changes/57/447857/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pending_jobs = [] for mapping in mappings: try: if mapping.AffectingElement and not self._is_job_completed( mapping.AffectingElement, ignore_error_state): pending_jobs.append(mapping.AffectingElement) except exceptions.x_wmi as ex: # NOTE(claudiub): we can ignore "Not found" type exceptions. if not self._is_not_found_exc(ex): raise def _is_not_found_exc(self, exc): hresult = win32utils.Win32Utils.get_com_error_hresult(exc.com_error) return hresult == self._WBEM_E_NOT_FOUND if not self._is_not_found_exc(ex):
deleted_lines: pending_jobs = [ mapping.AffectingElement for mapping in mappings if (mapping.AffectingElement and not self._is_job_completed(mapping.AffectingElement, ignore_error_state))] hresult = win32utils.Win32Utils.get_com_error_hresult( ex.com_error) if not hresult == self._WBEM_E_NOT_FOUND:

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary setUp function in testcase

In testcase, setUp will be called automatically. This patch used to
remove setUp functions that do nothing. Besides, it will keep code clean.

Change-Id: Id7641bc116c26f8b11f4441524c5e2c0442362a8

commit_message:
Add more periodic tests for OpenStack-Ansible

The periodic upgrade test has added quite a bit
of value, so now we'd like to extend the tests
with more actions and more branches.

commit_message:
Source the right environment for rh1

When we moved from rh2 to rh1, apparently we missed this file that
was still pointing at rh2 details.  It happens to work because the
addresses in rh1 and 2 are the same, but for the sake of sanity we
should use the correct file.

Change-Id: I440bb2dcfcbb800d491e217e391db1cad49ac1ae

subject: Allow ceph-osd to create temporary links within OSD's filesystem
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-30 15:51:32.000000000', 'files': ['files/apparmor/usr.bin.ceph-osd'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceph-osd/commit/9c869543ec63288b5b9d09768e1cb9040f066556', 'message': "Allow ceph-osd to create temporary links within OSD's filesystem

AppArmor profile prevents link operation within /var/lib/ceph/osd/*.
This leads to daemon coredump. This patch ensures ceph-osd
is able to create links.

Change-Id: Ia03baac0fec7f134f53254b18e5498a87656817f
Closes-Bug: #1677470
"}]
commit_message:
Allow ceph-osd to create temporary links within OSD's filesystem

AppArmor profile prevents link operation within /var/lib/ceph/osd/*.
This leads to daemon coredump. This patch ensures ceph-osd
is able to create links.

Change-Id: Ia03baac0fec7f134f53254b18e5498a87656817f
Closes-Bug: #1677470
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceph-osd refs/changes/80/451880/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: /var/lib/ceph/osd/** l,

This removes the extra blank space in the error message
'Adding a new attribute (%s)s to the root of  the resource
is not allowed'.

commit_message:
Move neutron profile out of step 4

This submission moves the neutron profile
`::tripleo::profile::base::neutron`
our of step 4.

Change-Id: I4d0617b0d7801426ea6827e70f5f31f10bbcc038
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/46/444746/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*bootstrap_node*] # (Optional) The hostname of the node responsible for bootstrapping tasks # Defaults to hiera('bootstrap_nodeid') # $bootstrap_node = hiera('bootstrap_nodeid', undef), $step = hiera('step'), ) { if $::hostname == downcase($bootstrap_node) { $sync_db = true } else { $sync_db = false } include ::tripleo::profile::base::neutron if $step >= 4 or ( $step >= 3 and $sync_db ) { class { '::neutron::services::bgpvpn': sync_db => $sync_db, }

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/67/451767/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Operating on more than one unit at a time ----------------------------------------- Systemd supports wildcarding for unit operations. To restart every service in devstack you can do that following:: sudo systemctl restart devstack@* Or to see the status of all Nova processes you can do:: sudo systemctl status devstack@n-* We'll eventually make the unit names a bit more meaningful so that it's easier to understand what you are restarting. journalctl -f --unit devstack@n-cpu.service --unitor you can even do wild cards to follow all the nova services:: journalctl -f --unit devstack@n-* And get all lines related to the request id or instance id. (Note: this work has been started at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/451525/)
deleted_lines: journalctl -f --unit devstack@n-cpu.service --user-unitAnd get all lines related to the request id or instance id. sub targets/slices ------------------ We might want to create per project slices so that it's easy to follow, restart all services of a single project (like swift) without impacting other services.

commit_message:
Add policy sample generation

This adds the entry point and config file necessary for using the
oslo.policy sample generation script. It also adds a tox target to
simplify the usage of it.

Change-Id: I7feb522b2ea5f56e48982169c7ebbb2ec2ef2cb3
Partially-Implements: bp policy-in-code
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/44/443344/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [testenv:genpolicy] commands = oslopolicy-sample-generator --config-file etc/keystone-policy-generator.conf

commit_message:
tox: Sets branch name to stable/ocata

Currently, the master branch of neutron is installed when running
tox, causing unit tests to fail.

Changes the tox BRANCH_NAME to stable/ocata.

Change-Id: I2bff358d9ac00052963da866bd5589a50533b611
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-hyperv refs/changes/47/451847/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: BRANCH_NAME=stable/ocata

commit_message:
ML2 Plugin sending stale network data

Ml2 plugin is sending a stale network data for
network update to mechanism_driver, which resulted
in qos_policy not being detached from network on
the backend side.

After processing update on network via extensions
it was reading from db before sending data to
mechanism_driver which was still stale. we can
expire session before fetching the data to get
the updated data.

Change-Id: I8260305567726a4f48c48ab0bb3197292e9175a8
Closes-Bug: #1675135

commit_message:
Validate NtpServers during plan processing

Moving this to an earlier function allows us to decouple the plan
processing from the heat_deploy which deploys the plan.  In future
it would be good to move this to a mistral validation instead of
a client-side special case.

Change-Id: If9e9fceb85408221cebbbacb8908f73b42268c19
Partial-Bug: #1635409

commit_message:
Allow ceph-osd to create temporary links within OSD's filesystem

AppArmor profile prevents link operation within /var/lib/ceph/osd/*.
This leads to daemon coredump. This patch ensures ceph-osd
is able to create links.

Change-Id: Ia03baac0fec7f134f53254b18e5498a87656817f
Closes-Bug: #1677470

commit_message:
Do not sync time after restarting of node

We have weird bug that can spawn 2 ntpd processes at the same time
by HA mechanism. Actually we have to sync time strictly only after
reverting a snapshot.

Change-Id: Ic73eb942eaacb436629841f9b12df844f3ac736d
Related-bug:1656020

commit_message:
Enable H201 - don't throw bare exceptions

I agree - bare except is bad - it can cause ctrl-c to stop working,
which is totally evil. (I mean, unless that is the intent, in which case
it's the right thing to do. None of these cases are cases when we desire
ctrl-c to stop working)

Change-Id: Ieffa26e8da77199c9ef7238a6c9f0704fc581ba6

commit_message:
Enable H238 - classes should be subclasses of object

As shade is no longer an Infra project, it's no longer appropriate to
ignore hacking. Luckily, shade is mostly hacking clean anyway, so this
isn't terribly disruptive.

Change-Id: I607f1835abb328e3b4a4a33d80a1848ab11779be

commit_message:
Fix a few minor annoyances that snuck in

We had the normal infra pep8 ignores marked, but follow some of them by hand
in this codebase anyway. While E12* are not valid pep8, the prevailing style
of shade is in agreement with them. While we weren't enforcing them, a few
instances snuck in. Fix them and just turn the flags on.

Change-Id: Iea2bd9a99eb8b20dd40418ac8479b809d3872de8

commit_message:
Add breakpoint cleanup env during plan processing

Move this environment addition to an earlier function, so we can
decouple the plan creation and environment processing from the actual
heat_deploy.

Change-Id: Icbeb2a3f6e819b213590bfb0e237d86ef49a3b1f
Partial-Bug: #1635409

commit_message:
Add creating a nova_cell0 database

The Compute service now need two databases, nova_cell0 in addition to
the standard nova db, so add a special case to create it.

Change-Id: Ifc455d5443ae0aadd51888884c36f053f3300736
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-ops-database refs/changes/01/443701/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Special case to create another DB for nova if service == 'nova' do openstack_common_database 'nova_cell0' do user node['openstack']['db'][service]['username'] pass password end end

commit_message:
Enable SR-IOV NIC offload feature discovery

Proposal to query NIC features and allow the Nova scheduler
to filter compute hosts based on those NIC features.

blueprint enable-sriov-nic-features

Change-Id: I23b39da6f09178bff14034aadd9e8f487c9e516f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/54/435954/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =========================================== Enable SR-IOV NIC offload feature discovery =========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/enable-sriov-nic-features Today, most networking hardware vendors implement some of the TCP/IP stack, traditionally done by the host operating system, in the NIC. By offloading some of these functions to dedicated hardware this frees up CPU cycles for applications running on the system. ``libvirt`` implemented the SR-IOV NIC offload feature discovery on version 1.2.14 [1]. Problem description =================== Currently, Nova doesn't retrieve any physical NIC information from the system. In particular, NIC offload features are very useful for network intensive applications. This information could be useful to determine, during the scheduling process, which host should contain a virtual machine. If a virtual machine, during the booting step, request a specific NIC offload feature, Nova Scheduler will filter those hosts with PCI devices having this feature. The aim of this spec is to fill this gap by proposing a method to read this information, to store this data, to use it during the scheduling process and to show how Neutron should be updated. Use Cases --------- * A network intensive application is going to be run in a virtual machine, using SR-IOV. The administrator creates a port to be used as a SR-IOV port (vnic-type: direct, physical-direct). Besides the current information stored in Neutron, a list of NIC offload features is added to this port in the "profile" parameter. When the administrator request a virtual machine along with this port, Nova Scheduler will search for a host with a PCI device and this set of NIC offload features. * Using the same example, a network intensive application is going to be run in a virtual machine, using SR-IOV. This time, the administrator can improve the PCI alias definition by adding the NIC feature list to the "pci_alias" configuration variable. The requested instance will require a PCI device with the defined NIC features. Proposed change =============== This spec proposes to implement the following changes in Nova: * A method to read the NIC feature information. * A method to store this information in the Nova DB. * An addition to "pci_alias" definition to include the NIC features. * A new implementation of Nova Scheduler PCI filter to include this new information. * An modification in the way of building an instace request to read the NIC features from the Neutron port and the Nova flavor extra_specs. NIC feature information ----------------------- The libvirt API currently provides the feature list of a NIC device. Using the command line utility we can retrieve the following information :: $ virsh nodedev-dumpxml net_ens785_68_05_ca_34_83_60 <device> <name>net_ens785_68_05_ca_34_83_60</name> <path>/sys/devices/pci0000:00/0000:00:02.0/0000:02:00.0/net/ens785</path> <parent>pci_0000_02_00_0</parent> <capability type='net'> <interface>ens785</interface> <address>68:05:ca:34:83:60</address> <link state='down'/> <feature name='rx'/> <-- example of NIC feature <feature name='tx'/> <feature name='sg'/> <feature name='tso'/> <feature name='gso'/> <feature name='gro'/> <feature name='rxvlan'/> <feature name='txvlan'/> <feature name='rxhash'/> <capability type='80203'/> </capability> </device> The parent of a NIC device is always a unique PCI device and the only child of this PCI devide is the NIC device. This spec proposes to add a new member to ``nova.virt.libvirt.config.LibvirtConfigNodeDevicePciCap`` class, called 'nic_features'. This member will be a list of strings, i.e., 'rx', 'tso' or 'rxhash'. This list is empty by default. If a PCI device is not a NIC interface or doesn't have any feature, the list will remain empty. Store the NIC features information ---------------------------------- A new table will be added to the database. This table will contain all feature parameters per PCI device if there are any. The new table will be described in 'Data model impact' section. This new table will contain a foreign key related with the uuid in the ``pci_devices`` table and a feature field, storing a string parameter which is the feature. This table has a 1:N relationship with ``pci_devices``. How to model the NIC features ----------------------------- This spec proposes two alternatives (TO BE DISCUSSED): 1) To extend the 'pci_alias' parameter in the configuration file. This parameter will contain a new parameter called 'nic_features'. This parameter will be a list of strings defining the NIC capability features available :: pci_alias = {"name": "fortville", "product_id": "1584", "vendor_id": "8086", "nic_features": "tso,rx,rxhash"} The 'pci_alias' parameter is used in the flavor extra_specs, by setting the name of a particular alias in "pci_passthrough:alias" extra_spec. 2) To replace the 'pci_alias' configuration parameter definition by creating a resource class containing the same information, adding the 'nic_features' field. Neutron port ``binding:profile`` -------------------------------- The Neutron data model and API is already defined. No modifications in Neutron project are needed. E.g.: how to define a Neutron port with NIC features information :: openstack port create --binding-profile '{"nic_features": "rx,tso"}' \ --network private port1 Modify Nova Scheduler filter ``PciPassthroughFilter`` ----------------------------------------------------- As it works now, the PCI request information during the boot of a virtual machine will come both from the PCI alias information provided in the flavor and the port definition passed in the boot command. With this feature, this set of requests will contain the NIC features list too for each PCI device. The Nova Scheduler filter ``PciPassthroughFilter`` will be modified to include the NIC features in the checking loop. As said before, this parameter is a list of strings. Each one of this strings is a NIC feature. This list, by default, is empty. Alternatives ------------ * To store NIC feature as a set strings, well known by Nova. Having this set of known features, Nova can check and accept only those known one. The problem is to keep an updated set of NIC features. Also this feature doesn't add any needed value. * The way the NIC features are stored. Instead of adding this values to a member list in the PCI object, an alternative could * To create a new member in Neutron ``port``, containing the feature information as a list of strings. However, this change doesn't add any value because currently there is a place, ``binding:profile``, to define and store this information. Data model impact ----------------- The PciDevice model needs to be modified, adding a new field: ``nic_features``. This new parameter will be defined as ``ListOfStringsField`` and will contain a list of NIC features. A new database table will be created. This table will contain for each PCI device several records. Each record is a NIC feature stored as a string. The database schema :: CREATE TABLE pci_devices_nic_features ( id INT(11) NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT, pci_device_uuid CHAR(36) NOT NULL, feature VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL, PRIMARY KEY (`id`), UNIQUE INDEX `pci_device_uuid0feature` (`pci_device_uuid`, `feature`) FOREIGN KEY (pci_device_uuid) REFERENCES pci_devices(uuid) ON DELETE CASCADE ); To retrieve one PciDevice object, a search in this new table will be done, listing all NIC features associated to this record. The list of features will be stored in the ``nic_features`` as a list of strings. REST API impact --------------- There is no impact in Nova API. There is no API access to PCI devices object. Security impact --------------- A new table is introduced in the DB. Because there is no API access to this data, there is no security impact. Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ The Nova Scheduler ``PciPassthroughFilter`` needs to include the 'NIC features' parameter into the checking loop, adding an extra time per host checked. In return, the list of passed hosts could be shorter because of the new restrictions. Other deployer impact --------------------- ``libvirt`` implemented the SR-IOV NIC offload feature discovery on version 1.2.14 [1]. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignees: Rodolfo Alonso <rodolfo.alonso.hernandez@intel.com> Sean K Mooney <sean.k.mooney@intel.com> Work Items ---------- 1. Add query parameter white list for server index/detail API. 2. Add sort parameter white list for sort_keys. 3. Add doc illustrate how to correctly use filter and sort params when list servers Dependencies ============ https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/consistent-query-parameters-validation Testing ======= Few unittest needs to be adjusted to work correctly. All the unittest and functional should be passed after the change. Once the CI with specific harware is added to Jenkins, new fullstack tests will be added. Documentation Impact ==================== The devref need to describe: * How to define the new parameters in the Nova Flavor extra specs fields. * How to define a new Neutron port with these new parameters. * The ``PciPassthroughFilter`` filter improvements using this new feature. References ========== [1] `https://libvirt.org/news-2015.html`

commit_message:
Fix 'ntpd -gq' false-positive exit code 0

Command 'ntpd -gq' is finished with exit code 0 even if
"no servers found" appeared.

Change-Id: Ib45afe7fccca91b402c8f370ede8f963e550921f
Related-Bug: #1656020
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-devops refs/changes/49/451749/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: set_date_cmd = "ntpd -gqd" def _set_time(self): # Try to get current time from a parent server res = self.remote.execute(self.set_date_cmd) if res['exit_code']: # Exit code is not 0 return False if any(['no servers found' in s for s in res['stdout']]) # Workaround for "exit_code == 0" if no servers found return False return True # Wait for a parent server until it starts providing the time self._set_time,
deleted_lines: # Waiting for parent server until it starts providing the time set_date_cmd = "ntpd -gq" lambda: not self.remote.execute(set_date_cmd)['exit_code'],

commit_message:
Use new register nodes commands for newton and newer

According to [1] the commands to register nodes after
mitaka have changed to use "openstack overcloud node import".

This patch adopts new command for any release different
that mitaka.

Partial-Bug: #1675384

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/developer/tripleo-docs/basic_deployment/basic_deployment_cli.html

Change-Id: I3ee35a5d100891b631a73f426950fffb585dc458
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/60/449160/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {% if release == 'mitaka' %} {% elif step_introspect %} openstack overcloud node import instackenv.json {% else %} openstack overcloud node import instackenv.json --provide {% endif %}

commit_message:
playbooks: roles: Drop obsolete dib-utils package

Upstream diskimage-builder commit d65678678ec0 ("Move dib-run-parts
into diskimage-builder") moved the dib-run-parts utility to the
diskimage-builder repository which effectively declared the dib-utils
package as retired. Therefore, there is no need to install this package
anymore.

Link: https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/?id=d65678678ec0416550d768f323ceace4d0861bca
Change-Id: I350f5028ca4f58227af80edaf4c56374dca0d9cb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bifrost refs/changes/26/451426/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: Dependencies ------------ dib-utils must be installed from pip for the image creation to work.

commit_message:
Flush the buffer when printing the debug details

Without flushing the buffer, the content of the YAML file is interleaved
with the output from testr.

six.print_ provides the same signature as the print function from
python3 (with the flush parameter).

Change-Id: I189845455c769739d150d8cf9f78c2a031f2b752
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-tests refs/changes/45/451745/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: six.print_("Template variables:\n%s" % (variables), flush=True) six.print_("YAML from %s:\n%s" % (scenario_config, yaml.safe_dump( yaml_file, allow_unicode=True, default_flow_style=False)), flush=True)
deleted_lines: print("Template variables:\n%s" % (variables)) print("YAML from %s:\n%s" % (scenario_config, yaml.safe_dump(yaml_file, allow_unicode=True, default_flow_style=False)))

commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I8b181c1b049105fdd698385c4aba3546126a53dc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-saharaclient refs/changes/36/451636/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return dict((k, v) for (k, v) in kwargs.items() if v is not None)
deleted_lines: return dict((k, v) for (k, v) in six.iteritems(kwargs) if v is not None)

commit_message:
Update Docker to 1.13.1

There were a few issues blocking Kolla from going up to the
latest version of Docker which is 1.13.  Most of these issues
seem to have been addressed by 1.13.1.

This patch updates the version installed by Kolla to 1.13.1
for the testing infrastructure to prevent the following
bug which is causing gate failures:

https://github.com/docker/docker/issues/28336

Change-Id: I0d3569b589ee792c9aa6eaa7c539219fcc784271

commit_message:
fixed the mistake in using update job web page

In page "create job" configuration interval help information
is following some format,but when "update" is not the same.

Change-Id: I83761bbea9d6fd4b226254a8a018d27a792def1c

success_message = _('Job updated correctly.') failure_message = _('Unable to update job.') success_url = "horizon:disaster_recovery:jobs:index" default_steps = (InfoConfiguration,) def handle(self, request, context): try: if context['job_id'] != '': freezer_api.Job(request).update(context['job_id'], context) return shortcuts.redirect('horizon:disaster_recovery:jobs:index') except Exception: exceptions.handle(request) return False

Remove runtime depend on pbr

There is actuall no runtime depend. There is a build time depend, but
that's taken care of already.

commit_message:
Update tox for OpenStack

requestsexceptions is now part of the shade project, so update
adminstrivia things. We should declare 3.5 support, and not 3.4 or 3.3,
since they're untested. We should also remove the infra exclusions since
it's no longer under that umbrella (also, no code changes were required)

Change-Id: Idc1a5449c6ed5a790083a63dfbd5815fbc9dd650
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requestsexceptions refs/changes/06/451306/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: envlist = pep8, py27, py35
deleted_lines: envlist = pep8, py27# These are ignored intentionally in openstack-infra projects; # please don't submit patches that solely correct them or enable them. ignore = E125,E129,H

commit_message:
Cleanup plugin loaded_base

neutron_plugin_loaded_base is only used in the template. This
var probably shouldn't be used by any deployer, so we mask this
variable from the defaults. Currently, we still keep this
overridable behavior: neutron_plugin_loaded_base can still
be overriden by a deployer, and we still rely on plugin_base if
the deployer hasn't defined it.

Change-Id: I8d7903dbb9a6f7d096eb3f840164b87c48eb5e4d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_neutron refs/changes/88/448088/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: neutron_plugin_loaded_base: >- {%- set plugins_loaded = [] -%} {%- for plugin in neutron_plugin_base -%} {%- set _ = plugins_loaded.append(plugin) -%} {%- endfor -%} {%- if (neutron_lbaasv2|bool) and ('neutron_lbaas.services.loadbalancer.plugin.LoadBalancerPluginv2' not in neutron_plugin_base) -%} {%- set _ = plugins_loaded.append("lbaasv2") -%} {%- endif -%} {{ plugins_loaded | join(',') }}
deleted_lines: neutron_plugin_loaded_base: "{% for plugin in neutron_plugin_base %}{{ plugin }}{% if not loop.last %},{% endif %}{% endfor %}{% if (neutron_lbaasv2|bool) and ('neutron_lbaas.services.loadbalancer.plugin.LoadBalancerPluginv2' not in neutron_plugin_base) %},lbaasv2{% endif %}"

commit_message:
Indicating the location tests directory in oslo_debug_helper

According to [1], we can passing a "-t" argument to
oslo_debug_helper to indicate the directory where tests
are located. This will solves ImportError exception.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslotest/features.html

Change-Id: I908bab196ae9a29e8c789db1dcd4668a7f855f87
Closes-Bug: #1666560
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-win refs/changes/15/443515/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: commands = oslo_debug_helper -t os_win/tests/unit {posargs}
